loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Zainab. She is married and has 3 children aged 22, 18, and 15 years.

In 1992, Zainab established her raw fish business. She began her business just to enable her to take care of her children as a single parent and that is her only source of livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL.  Zainab requires a new loan in order to buy raw fish. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. In the future, Zainab plans to establish her own cool room and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy raw fish for her business

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa prepares breakfast (rice porridge) for sale at Abrafo near Takoradi. She normally serves it with bread and fried eggs.  She is married to a farmer and has 2 children.

Yaa has been selling rice porridge for 2 years now. She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice, bread and eggs to prepare breakfast for sale. With the new profit, Yaa will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, bread and eggs to prepare breakfast for sale

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
Alie is a primary school teacher in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Alie is forty-four years old, married and the couple has four children together. His wife is a businesswoman and two of his children are attending primary and secondary school. Alie has been a teacher for ten years now.

He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children. Alie will repay his Kiva loan using his monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia operates a grocery and food stuffs shop, as she has done for 8 years now.   The items in her grocery shop are different kinds of drinks, biscuits, Maggi cubes, canned tomatoes, canned fish, salt, onions, etc.  She is married with 4 children.   Cecilia uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries and other food stuffs to resell. With the new profit, Cecilia plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to resell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a baker, she bakes bread  at Adum Banso near Takoradi. She is married to a mason and has 4 children.  Gladys has been baking for 6 years now.  She supports her husband in feeding and clothing their children.  She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery.  She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery

loans.name: Javohir

texts.ru: Чавохир 29 – летний женатый мужчина. У него двое детей. Он более семи лет занимается животноводством. Чавохир откармливает и продает скот. Он берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Javohir is a 29 year-old married man.  He has two children.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for over seven years.  Javohir fattens up and sells livestock.  He is requesting this loan to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and one school-aged child. He’s trying his best to fulfill his family's needs. He has been working as a taxi driver for two years and has gained a fair number of loyal customers so far. He works independently, on a freelance basis. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his child's school fees. This will help him to attend university. 

In the future, Abdallah plans to buy a minivan in order to target additional customers and earn a superior income.

loans.use: To pay his child’s school fees

loans.name: John P

texts.en:
John is 45 years old. He is married and has four children, aged 1, 3, 5 and 8 years. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to assist his wife with the household chores. In 2007, John established his patent medicines business. He began his business to cater to the sick and provide a livelihood for his family. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 2,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 

John would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. He has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan in order to pay for medical drugs. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. 

In the future, John plans to improve his business, make more profits, and to give his children the best education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for medical drugs

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Sarswati is 51 years old. She is married and has two children who are 30 and 28 years old. In 1997, she established her grocery store.  Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she supports her family. Sarswati has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW, and she used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping their inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase their profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, it is always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Chila

texts.ru: Чила более пяти лет занимается торговлей строительных инструментов и материалов. Кроме того он продает хозяйственные товары. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он берет кредит для увеличения товарооборота
texts.en: Chila has been involved in selling construction materials and tools for over five years.  Besides this, he also sells household goods.  He is 34 years old, married and has five children.  Chila is requesting this loan to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Izatullo

texts.ru: Изатулло уже десять лет как занимается торговлей. Он занимается торговлей строительных материалов и хозяйственных товаров. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он берет кредит для закупа стройматериалов.
texts.en: Izatullo has been involved in sales for ten years.  He sells construction materials and household goods.  He is 30 years old, married and has three children.  Izatullo is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомчон житель района Восеъ. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Рядом с домом Илхомчон открыл столовую, где каждый клиент может заказать плов. Сам он работает поваром. В этой области он год. Кредит берет для приобретения мебели и новой посуды.
texts.en: Ilhomjon is a resident of the Vose district.  He is 29 years old, married and has four children.  Ilhomjon opened a cafe near his house, where every customer can order plov.  He works as a cook himself.  He has been in this business for one year.  Ilhomjon is requesting this loan to purchase furniture and new dishware.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and new dishware

loans.name: Firas

texts.en: Firas is a 36-year-old married soldier in the Jordanian army. He lives in Zarqa city with his wife and five children (four are two twins). In addition to being an army soldier, Firas also owns a small store that sells hookahs and hookah accessories to provide a better life for his family. Therefore, Firas would like a loan to expand his store and  repaint the front of his store and and for the purchase of smokers supplies such as coal and honeyed tobacco to increase his profit and provide a better life for his growing family.

loans.use: to repaint the front of his store and for the purchase smokers supplies, such as coal and honeyed tobacco

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 37 years old. She is married and has four children aged four, 13, 15, and 18 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she is in school. In 2007, Fatmata established her baby items business. She started her business because she wants to provide assistance to her husband and because the business provides solutions to her immediate domestic needs. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 400,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Fatmata would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy bottles, diapers, powder, and toy mobile phones. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to transform her stall into an established shop, to assist her husband, and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy baby items and clothing

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He was capable of covering their heavy costs of living in addition to his children’s school fees. He opened his own bakery four years ago. 

Today, he wants to borrow $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added raw materials for his bakery such as salt, flour, and many other items. He notes that this will improve his work, which allows him attract more clients. In the future, he plans to renovate and expand his bakery.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his bakery

loans.name: Zebonisso

texts.ru: Зебониссо уже два года как занимается торговлей на рынке. Ей 41 год. Она в основном занимается торговлей одежды. Зебониссо более 12 лет проработала медсестрой. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Целью получения кредита является приобретение собственной торговой точки.
texts.en: Zebonisso has been involved in sales at a market for two years.  She is 41 years old.  She primarily sells clothing.  Zebonisso has worked as a nurse for over 12 years.  She is married and has four children.  The goal of obtaining this loan is to purchase her own retail outlet.

loans.use: to purchase her own retail outlet

loans.name: Patrick O.

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Patrick, a primary schoolteacher in Makeni. Forty-nine-year-old Patrick was born in Makeni. He is married and has five children. His wife is a businesswoman, and his children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Patrick has served in the teaching profession for ten years now. He has requested this loan in order to invest in agriculture. He will be buying seeds to plant on his farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds to plant on his farm

loans.name: Victorial

texts.en: Victorial sells eggs, oranges, and soft drinks at Adum Banso near Takoradi, Ghana. She has been selling these items for two years now. Victorial is married to a driver and has one child. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of her family. Victorial will use her loan to purchase more eggs, oranges and soft drinks to sell. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs, oranges, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth, es habitan del municipio de San Caralampio, junto a su familia, ella desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de cítricos, la gran afectación que se le presenta es las cenizas del volcán, ya que todo el cultivo de naranjas dulces se quemo debido a este fenómeno que afecto a toda la población que se dedica a los trabajos de campos. Los planes hacia un futuro es poder diversificar el cultivo para obtener mejores ingresos ya que la agricultura es de vital importancia para ellos por que es fuente de sobrevivencia. El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para iniciar el ciclo de producción .
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives with her family in the town of San Caralampio.  For the past few years she has earned her living raising citrus fruits.  What has hurt her most, and affected everyone who farms, is the volcanic ash because it burned the entire crop of sweet oranges.  

In the future Elizabeth plans to increase her income; agriculture is the source of survival, so it's of vital importance.   Elizabeth wants to use her loan to buy fertilizers and the supplies she needs to start out the next production cycle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Abdul Y.

texts.en:
Abdul is a primary schoolteacher in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Born in the village of Rononkoh in northern Sierra Leone, the 44-year-old is married to a trader, and the couple has five children. Abdul has come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan. With the help of this loan, he can solve some of his financial challenges that, with his salary alone, he cannot solve. 

With the help of this loan, he can meet some of his immediate financial challenges and then repay the loan using his monthly salary. Abdul will use this loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is married to a driver and has six dependents. She sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together) and serves it with gari, macaroni, meat, and fish stew. Salamatu has been selling waakye for four years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Salamatu needs this loan to purchase bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye. With the new profits, Salamatu wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, and other ingredients

loans.name: Alhaji O.

texts.en:
Alhaji is a primary schoolteacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. The 32-year-old Alhaji has served in the teaching profession for ten years now. A native of Makeni, Alhaji is married, and the couple has two children, who are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Alhaji has requested this loan from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT)/Kiva lenders in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice sells rice and waakye (rice and beans cooked together). She serves the waakye with gari, macaroni, meat, and fish stew at Adum Banso, Ghana. She also buys rice in sacks and resells it in smaller quantities. Beatrice has been selling rice and waakye for four years now. 

Beatrice is married to a farmer and has four children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. She needs this loan to purchase bags of rice to sell as well as other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye. With the new profits, Beatrice will expand her rice business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice and other ingredients

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его дети учатся в средней школе. Жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается скотоводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа коровы, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Sherali lives in the Dangara district.  He is 40 years old, married and has three children.  His children attend a secondary school.  His wife is a homemaker.  Sherali is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds livestock for subsequent sale.  Sherali is requesting this loan to purchase a cow in order to increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Yolanda Carolina

texts.es:
Yolanda Carolina, de 31 años de edad, casada desde hace 7 años, tiene dos hijas de 3 y 6 años de edad, vive en Col. Lomas del  Carmen San Pedro Sula.
A Yolanda siempre le ha gustado el comercio,  anteriormente vendía ropa usada, ahora ha encontrado otro medio de vida,  ya tiene 3 años de dedicarse a  vender  comida como pan casero,  avena con leche,  pastelitos con carne, baleadas, tacos, tortilla con quesillo,  jugos naturales en bolsa  y café. Primero vendía solo jugos y a solicitud de los clientes empezó hacer la comida.
Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante, ella vende en  un coche pequeño de mano.   Vende 2 horas por la mañana para el desayuno y 4 horas por la tarde todos los días.
 Esta solicitando L.5,500.00 para invertirlo en el negocio, del cual va comprar insumos como azúcar, harina, café, leche, avena, frutas, manteca, pollo  y otros, para la elaboración de comida y jugos. Ella tiene como meta hacer crecer su negocio para lograr obtener  su propia casa.
texts.en:
Yolanda Carolina, age 31, has been married for seven years.  She has two daughters, ages three and six.  She lives in Colonia Lomas del Carmen in San Pedro Sula.

Yolanda has always liked business.  She previously sold used clothes.  Now she has found another way of making a living.  For three years she has been selling food like homemade bread, oatmeal with milk, meat pastries, "baleadas" (flour tortillas with beans, eggs, butter, cheese and meat), tacos, tortillas with soft cheese, bags of natural juices, and coffee.  At first she only sold juices, but at her customers’ request she started to make food.

She carries out this business activity in an itinerant manner.  She sells from a small handcart.  She sells breakfast for two hours in the morning and lunch for four hours in the afternoon every day.

She is requesting 5,500 lempiras to invest in the business.  She will buy supplies like sugar, flour, coffee, milk, oatmeal, fruit, butter, chicken and others to make food and juices.  Her goal is to make her business grow in order to get her own house.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sugar, flour, oatmeal, milk, coffee, fruit, butter, and chicken to make food.

location.town: Col. Lomas del Carmen, San Pedro Sula.

loans.name: Kadiatu Tejan S.

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo is Kadiatu, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. Kadiatu has been a professional teacher for 10 years now. A native of Portloko town in northern Sierra Leone, Kadiatu is age 31. She is married to a teacher, and the couple has two children together.  

Kadiatu has requested for this loan in order to pay her college fees. At the end of each month, Kadiatu will then repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay her college fees.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells second-hand clothing and also cooks food for sale at Adum Banso. Ama has completed junior high school. She is married and has one child.  Her husband is a driver. 

Ama has been selling cooked food and second-hand clothing for three years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their child’s school fees. 

Her loan will be used to purchase more second-hand clothes and to buy foodstuffs that will be used to prepare the food for sale. She would like to use the profit from this expanded business to acquire a shop for the sale of clothing.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothes and to buy foodstuffs that will be used to prepare the food for sale.

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en: In the photo above is Yayah. Yayah is a secondary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. Yayah has served in the teaching profession for 30 years now. A native of Makeni city, Yayah is married to a trader, and the couple has 10 children: seven in secondary school and three in primary school. Yayah has requested for this loan from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy operates a grocery at Adum Banso; she has done this for three years now. The items in her grocery shop are different kinds of soft drinks, biscuits, toffees, cooking oil, tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, powdered milk, etc.  

She is married with three children. Lucy uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Lucy plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Unión y Trabajo se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 16 y 7 años de edad las mismas que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora que siempre mira por el bienestar de su familia,  trabaja en una fábrica que elabora botones en la ciudad pero además también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo,  una vez que termina su jornada diaria en la fábrica, ella se dedica a recorrer con sus productos por toda la localidad donde tiene sus clientes aunque también les vende a sus compañeros que trabajan con ella, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien ya que con esto siempre ha estado pendiente de las necesidades de sus hijas.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, entre otras prendas. Lleva más de 8  ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le ayudan en su negocio. 

Su sueño es que a sus hijas nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The Unión y Trabajo Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches that are heavily frequented throughout the year, and for being city of unparalleled beauty with lots of tourist attractions.  

This is where Maria, 46, lives in a civil union that has produced two daughters, a 16-year-old who is in college, and a 7-year-old who is in elementary school.  Maria's husband is a shopkeeper.  

Maria is very hardworking and a real fighter who is always looking out for the well being of her family.  She works in a button factory in the city, but in addition she sells all manner of clothing.  As soon as she finishes up her day job at the factory she takes her products around her entire sales region.  She also sells to her coworkers.  She takes credit and collects every eight days.  She's been in business for eight years, and things have gone very well for her, allowing her to be attentive to her daughters' needs at all times.

Maria is seeking a loan to buy pants, shirts, and other clothing.  She has completed more than eight loan cycles with the village bank and she likes it because the loans always help her with her business.

Her dream is that her daughters will lack for nothing.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, and other clothing.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has six children, aged 2, 5, 6, 12, 15 and 18 years. He has two additional dependents, who live with him because he is their relative. 

In 1998, Mohamed established his used shoes business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,600,000 Sierra Leone leone (Le) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy shoes for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to expand the business to another location. He hopes to see the business grow from a kiosk to a concrete shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for used shoes.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, de 35 años de edad, es un hombre alegre y trabajador; vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Faustina de 52 años y su hija Andrea de 10 años a quien desean un buen bienestar. Jesús, es un hombre centrado y con muchas responsabilidades que cumplir para el bien de su ámbito familiar y  por ello se despierta  muy temprano para dirigirse a su centro de labor y abrir las puertas de su negocio en espera de sus primeros consumidores. Lleva 20 años que viene dedicándose a la de venta de productos de primera necesidad, tales como sacos de arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes, gaseosas, entre otros. Se siente muy contento en su puesto de trabajo, por que gracias a su puesto de ventas, construyó su propia casa y con ello también sustenta los gastos de educación de su querida hija. Su  puesto de ventas se sitúa en dentro de su comunidad y es muy concurrido por sus vecinos. Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado, comprará productos de abarrotes para su tienda y así no quedar mal con sus clientes. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP y esta contento por brindarle el apoyo que necesitaba para seguir con sus planes de trabajo. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles; comprará productos de abarrotes para su tienda: arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes, gaseosas y entre otros.
texts.en:
Jesús, 35, is a happy and hardworking man.  He lives in his own house with his wife Faustina, 52, and daughter, Andrea, 10, for whom they wish good well-being.  Jesús is a focused man with many responsibilities to take care of for the good of his family environment.  This is why he wakes up very early to get to work and open the doors of his business to wait for his first customers.

He has been working for 20 years selling household necessity products such as bags of rice, sugar, noodles, detergent, soda, and others.  He feels very happy in his job because thanks to his store he built his own house and also pays for his beloved daughter's educational expenses.  His store is located in his community and is very crowded with his neighbors.

With the support of the requested loan he will buy grocery products for his store so he will not look bad to his customers.  This will be his first loan with MFP and he is happy about them offering the help he needed to continue with his work plans.

With the 1,500 PEN he will buy grocery items for his store: rice, sugar, noodles, detergent, and soda, among others.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar, noodles, detergent, and soda.

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es: Reymundo, de 33 años de edad, convive María de 22 años; viven en casa propia junto a sus 02 hijos Isaac de 04 años y Aimar de 01 año, quienes son el motivo de poder sobresalir. Reymundo, es campesino, sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde muy niño. Viene trabajando en su propia chacra hace 13 años donde cultiva los siguientes productos: plantas de cacao, café y hojas de coca.  En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros. Sabe muy bien el dinero que obtiene es por producir buena calidad de frutos. Sus productos de cacao y café los comercializa  en la ciudad de San Francisco, puesto que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen por la calidad de sus granos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es trasladar lo cosechado desde la cosecha hasta el punto de secado. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción. Este es su préstamo número 01 con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que le ayuden en el desmonte de sus cultivos y con el resto comprará fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Reymundo, age 33, lives with 22 year old María.  They live in their own house with their two children; Isaac is four and Aimar is one.  Their children are what motivate them to be able to do well.

Reymundo is a farmer.  His parents taught him this trade when he was very young.  He has been working on his own farm for 13 years.  He grows the following products:  cacao plants, coffee, and coca leaves.  At harvest time he has help from day laborers.  He knows very well that the money he gets is for producing good quality fruits.  He sells his cacao and coffee in the city of San Francisco because that is where he gets better prices for his quality grains. 

What he likes the most about his work is harvesting the fruits.  That way he feels that the months of arduous labor compensate him with the quality of the fruits.  He feels that the most difficult part is transporting the harvest from the farm to the drying area.  

Later on he hopes to buy new land in order to increase his production.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He feels that the loan will help him a lot to make progress in his work.  He is very well-liked by his colleagues in his communal bank because he is very supportive of them.  He will use the 1,500 soles to hire day laborers to help him pick the crops.  He will use the rest to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to hire day laborers and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Ketty Rocio

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Unión y Trabajo se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Ketty, tiene 46 años  de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, dos mayores y el menor de 16 años de edad el mismo que  estudian en colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Lleva seis ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que la institución le ha brindado.

Ella para sacar adelante a su hijo menor se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y cobra cada 15 días, esto lo viene realizando desde hace tres años y le ha ido muy bien, además sus hijos mayores también le ayudan económicamente ya que ellos trabajan y son un gran aporte en los gastos del hogar.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas.
 
Su sueño es ver que su hijo menor  termine sus estudios y sea un gran  profesional.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Union and Work” meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are highly visited year-round, and for being a city with unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Here we meet Ketty, who is 46 years old and is a single mother with three children, two grown and one a minor of 16 years who is studying in high school. All her children still live in her house. She has done six loans with the Communal Bank and likes it because of the help and benefits that the institution gives her. 

To help her youngest child get ahead, she makes a living selling products from Avon, Yanbal catalogues (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women.) She works three days a week, mostly in the mornings, since it is easiest to do her rounds then. She sells door to door, selling on credit and charging every 15 days. She has been doing this for three years, and it has gone very well. On top of that, her older children also help her economically, since they work and are a great help with the household expenses. 

She is going to put this loan towards the purchase of perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams. 

Her dream is to see her youngest child finish his studies and become a great professional.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, cosmetics, costume jewelry, and creams.

loans.name: America Patricia

texts.es:
La señora América, tiene 28 años, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo (4 años), reside en la comunidad  15 de Octubre, ubicada en el municipio de San Pedro Sula.
Desde hace 6 años tiene un negocio de pulpería en donde  se dedica a tiempo completo a la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser granos básicos, carne de pollo, carne de res, carne de cerdo, manteca, leche y refrescos.
En la actualidad ha solicitado un préstamo por la suma de 5000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de carnes y productos varios para surtir la pulpería.
Doña América espera aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos que le permitirán crecer en su negocio junto a ODEF.
texts.en:
América, 28, is a single mother; she has a 4-year-old son.  She lives in the community of 15 de Octubre located in the municipality of San Pedro Sula.  She’s had a grocery store for the last six years where she works full-time selling basic staple items like basic grains, chicken, beef, pork, lard, milk and soft-drinks.

She is currently asking for a 5000 Lempira loan to buy meat and various products to stock her grocery store.  América hopes to increase sales and income so that she can grow in business together with ODEF.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort cooks banku (fermented cassava dough) for sale; she serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomatoes sauce in Adum Banso, near Takoradi. She is married to a farmer and has four dependents. Comfort has done this for four years. She uses her income to assist her husband with paying their accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she will use to prepare her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish that she uses in preparing her banku for sale.

loans.name: Alondritas Group

texts.es:
Liliana en su juventud soñaba con la pintura y los cuadros. El destino y las oportunidades la llevaron por otro destino. Ahora esta casada y es madre de dos hijos. Pensando en crear un medio para apoyar en la solvencia económica, inicio un negocio que le permitía retomar su sueño. Decidió realizar grabados en cerámica, pintarlos y ofrecerlos como recuerdos típicos de la región, un detalle muy mexicano para adornar cualquier hogar.
Hoy ella decide tomar un crédito para invertir en material y tener más moldes de cerámica y con esto ofrecer más opciones a sus clientes.
Cuenta con clientes que le realizan pedidos de piezas para obsequiar  y esto la ha dado a conocer en el mercado.
Liliana esta orgullosa de ver que todo esfuerzo tiene frutos.
texts.en:
In her youth, Liliana dreamed of paint and paintings but destiny and opportunity took her to a different destiny.  Now, she’s married and the mother of two children.  

Thinking about creating a way to help with economic solvency, she starts a business that allows her to retake her dream.  She decided to paint on ceramics and sell them as typical souvenirs of the region, a very Mexican detail to adorn any home.

Today, she’s decided to take out a loan to buy materials and more ceramic molds so that she can offer a wider variety to her customers.

She has customers that order pieces to give away as gifts and this has made her well-known in the marketplace.

Liliana is proud that her efforts are bearing fruit.

loans.use: to buy supplies and molds for her ceramics.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom a été crée le10/12/2010.Il est composé de 12 femmes issue de la même localité, elle sont des voisines,des parents, des amies en bonne entente. Elles exercent la même activité qui est le commerce. Absa Coumba debout à droite sur la photo est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04.enfants. Elle fait le petit commerce de tissus, des chaussures. Avec son prêt reçu, elle va s'approvisionner jusqu'à Dakar ou à Touba pour revendre dans son village. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Jom was created on 10/12/2010.  It is comprised of 12 women all coming out of the same locality; they are neighbours, parents, and friends who get along well.  They operate in the same sort of business, trading.

Absa Coumba, standing to the right in the photo, is the person in charge of the group.  She is 44 years old.  She is the married mother of four children.  She has a small business dealing in fabrics and shoes.  

Should she receive a loan, she will stock up in Dakar or in Touba goods for resale in her village.  Her profits will allow her to support her husband in the undertaking of family needs.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Rita Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Unión y Trabajo se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rita, tiene 61 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella además de un nieto de 16 años que es como su hijo y estudia en colegio.

Ella tiene un negocio en su casa en el cual vende mariscos y ropa de todo tipo, en las mañanas se desplaza hasta la playa donde consigue los mariscos a mejor precio y los mejores para luego llevarlo a su local, lugar hasta donde llegan sus clientes a comprar sus productos. La venta de ropa lo hace puerta a puerta, sale en las noches a ofrecer sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y  cobra cada fin de semana.  Su negocio de ropa lo tiene hace 8 años y que lo que es la venta de  mariscos era a lo que se dedicaba su difunto esposo, pero hace 4 años ella administra este negocio con su nieto que es quien le ayuda.

Este crédito es para invertirlo en sus dos negocios, va a comprar mariscos y ciertas prendas de vestir. Lleva más de  8  años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó  su negocio de venta de ropa.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The “Unión y Trabajo” (Unity and Work) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are popular year-round and because it’s a city of unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions.

We met Rita, 61, here.  Her beloved husband died several years ago but she had five children with him all of which are now adults; one of them, as well as a 16-year-old grandson who is like a son to her and attends school, still live with her.

She has a home-based business where she sells seafood and all types of clothing.  In the morning she heads out to the beach where she buys the best seafood at the best prices and takes it to her locale where her customers come by to purchase her products.  She sells the clothing door to door.  She goes out in the evening to offer her products that she sells on credit and collects payments for every weekend.  She’s had the clothing business for 8 years.  The seafood business was what her late husband ran but she’s been running it for the last four years with her grandson who helps her.

This loan is to invest in both businesses.  She will buy seafood and certain articles of clothing.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than 8 years and likes it because she used the first loan to start her clothing business.  Her dream is to continue forward and that she and her loved ones are in good health.

loans.use: to buy sea food and articles of clothing.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maiz,la socia tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes,pollos y chanchos,la socia los hace engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la chicha y los animales.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes,pollos y chanchos y tambien para comprar maiz para preparar la chicha.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues to sell chicha which is a beverage made from corn.  She also is raising animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.  She fattens them up and then sells them in various street markets that exist.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the chicha and the animals.  She’s asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens and pigs and also to buy corn to make chicha.  She’s happy with the loan and committed to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and corn.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: La socia continua con su trabajo y conla atencion y administracion de sus propia tienda de abarrotes; la socia desea en esta ocasión como en la anterior invertir el prestamo en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, harina, aceite entre otros. La socia tiene el sueño de ver a su familia realizada y prospera.
texts.en: She continues working tending to and running her own grocery store.  On this occasion, like previously, she wants to use the loan to buy basic staple goods like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, flour and oil, among others.  Her dream is to see her family fulfilled and prosperous.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mahmadsami

texts.ru: Махмадсами проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 43 года. Он разведен. Он уже два года как занимается торговлей на рынке. Махмадсами имеет торговую точку, где продает фрукты. Целью получения кредита является покупка зимних фруктов.
texts.en: Mahmadsami lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 43 years old and divorced. He has worked with trade at the market for two years. Mahmadsami owns a retail stand, where he sells fruit. The purpose of getting a loan is to buy winter fruit.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for sale

loans.name: Yaned

texts.es:
La socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de tienda de abarrotes pero no le fue muy bien en este negocio,la socia ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,ella vende estofado de pollo,pollo al horno y sopas,ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,carne,pollo y verduras.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She used to run a grocery store but didn’t do too well in this business.  Now, she’s working in a food preparation business; she sells chicken stew, roasted chicken and soups.  She sells in an ambulatory way from 8am until 7pm and is able to support her children with this business.  Her dream is to own a restaurant.  She’s asking for the loan to buy ingredients to cook like rice, meat, chicken and vegetables.  She’s happy with the loan and committed to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Nancy;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de queso, yogurt y manjar ella prepara estos productos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia lleva años en este negocio siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia vende en las ferias y mercados donde estan sus clientes que le solicitan,a la vez la socia se dedica a la ganaderia ,la socia es una persona bien responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de sus quesos,yogurt y manjar como azucar.
texts.en:
Nancy alternates her daily activities with a business selling cheese, yogurt and ‘manjar’ [a sweet].  She makes these products and then sells them to customers that request them.  

She’s been in this business for years and this is the way she supports her family.  She sells in markets and street markets where her customers are.  She also raises livestock.  She’s quite a responsible person who very much wants to get ahead.

She’s asking for the loan to buy ingredients to make cheese and yoghurt and ingredients, like sugar, for the manjar.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cheese, yoghurt and "manjar."

loans.name: Sharof

texts.ru: Шароф занимается развозкой грузов по городу Истаравшан. Этим видом деятельности он занимается два года. Он женат. Ему 28 лет. У него трое детей. Он берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en:
Sharof works with transporting goods in the city of Istaravshan. He has been engaged in this activity for two years. He is married, and he is 28 years old. He has three children. 

Sharof takes a loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Richard

texts.es: Richard de 27 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y responsable; vive en su propia casa junto con su esposa Raquel de 26 años y sus 03 hijos quienes son el motivo de esfuerzo por sobresalir en el futuro. Hace 10 años que Richard junto a su esposa empezaron a trabajar en propia chacras, pero ellos querían un bienestar para sus hijos y con sus ahorros lograron tener su propia tienda de abarrotes. Hoy, se sienten muy contentos ya que han cumplido con uno de sus primeros objetivos, lo cual le está arrojando buenos resultados económicos, debido a la calidad y la variedad de productos que ofrece a su clientela. Normalmente trabajan por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su propia casa, ubicada en la comunidad de Samaniato. Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de arroz, azúcar, detergentes y golosinas. El anhela en un futuro próximo mejorar su tienda de abarrotes, con la finalidad de que le dé un formato distinto a sus demás competencias y de esa manera mantener a sus clientes teniendo los productos necesarios. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está conforme con su banco comunal, ya que todos cumplen con sus compromisos de pago. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar más productos de abarrotes para incrementar en su tienda.
texts.en:
Richard, 27, is a hardworking, responsible man living in his own house with his wife, Raquel, 26, and their three children who are the motivating factors behind his efforts to stand out in the future.  

Ten years ago Richard and his wife started working their own fields but they wanted wellbeing for their children so used their savings to open their own grocery store.  

Today, they feel very happy because they’ve reached one of their main objectives which is producing good economic results due to the quality and variety of products he offers his clientele.  Normally they work alone but sometimes their children help out.  His sales point is his own house located in the community of Samaniato.

He will use the requested loan to buy sacks of rice, sugar, detergent and snacks.  He hopes in future to improve his grocery store so that he can give it a different format from the competition so that he can keep his clientele by having the necessary products in stock.

This will be MFP loan #1 which he commits to repay according to the payment schedule.  He’s satisfied with his communal bank because everyone makes their payments.  He will use the 1500 new soles to buy more grocery items to increase the stock in his store.

loans.use: to buy staple items to stock his store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de 34 años de edad es un hombre responsable y trabajador; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Antonia de 34 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, quienes son la razón de todos sus esfuerzos. Samuel, se esmera por dar lo mejor de si mismo y ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a su familia, por lo cual trabaja arduamente sus tierras cultivados con plantas de cacao y café. Samuel  es conocedor del arduo trabajo que se realiza en el campo, donde viene trabajando 25 años en sus propias tierras. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para luego ser transportados de manera artesanal. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias, cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque son meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos perjudicando a sus sembríos. Este es su préstamo número 01 con MFP, Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo  para poder cumplir sus objetivos y por lo cual esta llano en cumplir con el pago de su préstamo puntualmente. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará  sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras y posteriormente volverlas productivas.
texts.en:
Samuel, 34, is a responsible, hardworking man living in his own house with his wife, Antonia, 34, and their three beloved children who are the reason behind all his efforts.

Samuel strives to give the best of himself and offer his family a good quality of life which is why he works hard in his cocoa bean and coffee fields.  Samuel is well aware of the hard work working in the fields entails since he’s been working his own land for 25 years.  During harvest time his children help him and day laborers are in charge of harvesting and transporting the picked beans a certain distance to then be transported in an artisanal way.  He feels very committed to his work because thanks to his daily effort today he enjoys seeing that his plants bear fruit leading to good profits.  He comments that winter is not pleasing to him because these are the months when insects abound that damage crops.

This is MFP loan #1 and he hopes this small loan will help him reach his objectives and he’s determined to make his payments punctually.  He will use the 1500 new soles to buy sacks of manure to fertilize his land to make them productive later on.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Yanett Del Pilar

texts.es: La socia continua tejiendo chompas, chalinas, gorras, guantes, escarpines, entre otras prendas, la socia vende esto en un local alquilado y aún le falta ahorrar un poco para poder comprar un stand propio de tal manera que pueda ahorrar el alquiler y tener mas ingresos, la socia requiere en esta ocasión el prestamo para invertir en la compra de lanas para la realización de sus prendas.
texts.en: This borrower is still knitting sweaters, shawls, hats, gloves, leg-warmers, and other articles of clothing. She sells these items from a rented spot and she only needs to save a little more money to be able to buy her own stand. That way she will save money by not paying rent and will have more income. She needs a loan to purchase wool to make the clothing.

loans.use: buy wool to make articles of  clothing

loans.name: Liz Yocelin

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de golosinas pero ahora tambien tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This borrower is still working in the business of selling sweets but now she also has a grocery store where she sells basic merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 7:00 am until 10:00 pm and she wants her business to help her get ahead. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is asking for a loan to buy products like rice, sugar, milk, and oil in bulk to stock her store. She is happy about the loan and committed to repaying it on time.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, milk, oil and other products in bulk for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is single and sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together). She serves it with gari (a grain made from grated cassava), macaroni, meat, and fish stew. Mariama has been selling waakye for three years now. She uses her income to pay her accommodation bill.  

Mariama needs this loan to purchase bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye for sale.

loans.name: Mi Dulce Hogar (Manta) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mi Dulce Hogar que está formado por 13 socias y 2 socios se reúne cada 15 días en Las Cumbres en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace un tiempo  atrás y formar este Banco Comunal el cual les ha servido de mucho para aumentar sus negocios. Por eso han solicitado un nuevo crédito, el otro crédito que recibieron de parte de la institución los beneficio mucho ya que aumentaron sus negocios y también mejoro su situación tanto económica como familiar,  en los pagos estuvieron muy bien y solo dos personas tuvieron algunos atrasos pero luego se pusieron al dia en los pagos, en si el crédito fue muy bueno y por esos están repitiendo el crédito con la institución.

La señora Rosario forma parte de este banco y está muy contenta de pertenecer hace tres ciclos.  Ella tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 14, 12 y 8 años de edad los mismos que estudian dos en colegio y  el menor en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual se dedica a la  venta de frutas y legumbres, él todos los días desde la madrugada se desplaza hasta el mercado de mayoristas de Manta para abastecerse de estos productos, luego se dedica a sus ventas por toda la ciudad la misma que recorre en un triciclo de su propiedad, ya tiene definidas las zonas por las que él vende y  tiene muchos clientes. Lleva 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas.

La foto pequeña adjunta se dé un socio y dos socias que por motivos del trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo. Los tres niños de la foto son hijos de dos de las socias.
texts.en:
The Mi Dulce Hogar (My Sweet Home) Community Bank is formed of 13 women and 2 men who meet every other week in Las Cumbres in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular throughout the whole year, and also for being a city with unmatched beauty and a lot of tourist attractions.

This is a group of people who decided to get together some time ago to form this community bank, which has greatly helped them grow their businesses. For this reason they have requested a new loan. The other loan they received from the institution benefited them greatly as it helped expand their businesses and also improved their lives, both financially and within their families. They were responsible with the payments and only two people fell behind but later got caught up with their payments. The loan was very good for them and so they are borrowing again from the institution.

Mrs. Rosario is part of this bank and she has happily belonged for three loan cycles. She is 35 years old and in a common-law marriage. She has three children who are 14, 12, and 8 years old and they are students-two in high school and the youngest in primary school. He husband works in sales.

She will use the loan for her husband's business selling fruits and vegetables. Every day he gets up very early to go to the Manta wholesale market to buy his produce. He then works selling all over the city on his own tricycle. He already has certain zones where he sells and he has a lot of customers. He has been doing this work for 7 years and it is going very well for him.

This loan is for buying fruits and vegetables. Her dream is to buy a car for the sales.

The small attached photo is of one man and two women who, for reasons of work, could not be present when the group photo was taken. The three children in the photo are children of two of the women.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Harth De Parquer Group

texts.es:
Blanca, es integrante del grupo de Harth de Parquer. Sus compañeras de crédito la invitaron a formar parte del grupo con la intención de impulsarla a invertir en lo que poco a poco se esta volviendo su negocio. Ella empezó a hacer comidas esporádicamente, según la iban recomendando,  para eventos especiales, como cumpleaños, aniversarios, entre otros. Entonces, solicitaba apoyo a sus vecinas pidiéndoles ollas y vasijas para poder cumplir con los pedidos. Esas mismas vecinas la motivaron para que se animara a invertir en ollas y vasijas y que lo viera como instrumentos de trabajo que cada vez utiliza con más frecuencia.
Estos consejos y analizar el crecimiento en sus pedidos, la llevaron a tomar la decisión de invertir y ser parte de este grupo y con ello crecer lo que ahora llama negocio propio.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the group Harth de Parquer. Her credit partners invited her to form part of the group with the intent to encourage her to invest in what, little by little, was becoming her business. She began to make food sporadically, based on recommendations,  for special events, like birthdays and anniversaries, among others. Then she solicited support from her neighbors, asking them for pots and vessels to be able to meet the requests. These same neighbors motivated her so that she was encouraged to invest in pots and vessels so that she would see them as instruments for her job that she uses more frequently each time. 

These tips, and the analysis of the increase in her business, led her to make the decision to invest and to be part of this group and with it to grow what she now calls her own business.

loans.use: invest in pots and vessels for a food business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace operates  a  chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold) which she has done for 10 years. The dishes  she  serves are meat  soup, fish soup,  and rice balls. She is married to a farmer and has 6 dependents.   Grace uses her income to help her husband to pay their children’s  school fees. She will use her loan to purchase bush meat and other ingredients to prepare  food for sale. With the new profit, Grace  plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase bush meat and other ingredients to prepare  food for sale.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina  cooks "banku" (fermented maize dough) for sale; she serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Adum Banso near Takoradi. She is married to a farmer and has four children.  Faustina has done this for three years.  She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to  purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses to prepare her "banku" for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a better stall for the sale of her cooked "banku" and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her "banku" for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace   operates  a  chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold) which she has done for 10 years. The dishes  she  serves  are meat  soup, fish soup,  and rice balls. She is married to a farmer and has three children.   Grace uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase  more meat and other ingredients to prepare  food for sale. With the new profit, Grace  plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase  more meat and other ingredients to prepare  food for sale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia  sells maize porridge; she serves the porridge with bread at Abrafo near Takoradi.  She is married to a driver and has four children.  Cecilia has been selling maize porridge for four years now. She is uses her income to help her husband to feed and  clothe their children.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her porridge and bread for sale. With the new profit, Cecilia will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her porridge and bread for sale

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is fifty-five years of age and is married with four children.

Malo owns & operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community.  She has three years of experience in this business.    Malo needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Malo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Malo's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Begg Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Begg Fallou est créé depuis le 9 décembre 2010; il est composé de quinze femmes qui sont voisines, elles sont animées par un sentiment de solidarité, de confiance et ont la possibilité de se réunir à chaque fois avant chaque rencontre mensuelle. Serigne Fallou est leur idole raison pour laquelle son nom est donné au groupe.
La responsable Khady est âgée de 28 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfant; elle est couturière et fait de la teinture parallèlement; elle a une bonne expérience de 6 ans.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en tissu carrelé jaune marron et a croisé les mains sur sa poitrine.
Elle achète ses tissus dans la ville voisine coud et vend à domicile. 

Elle souhaite avec son prêt renforcer ses activités de couture et teinture pour pouvoir se faire beaucoup de bénéfices.

Elle veut élargir son champ d'action afin de mieux réaliser une épargne plus consistante et gérer sa famille à l'avenir.
texts.en:
The Begg Fallou solidarity group was started on December 9th, 2010; it is comprised of fifteen women who are neighbours. They are driven by a feeling of solidarity, of trust, and they have the possibility to meet any time prior to each monthly gathering. Serigne Fallou is their idol—the reason for which his name was given to the group.

The leader, Khady, is 28 years old, she is unmarried and has no children; she is a seamstress and handles colouration at the same time; she has a good six years of experience. She is standing at the right of the photo dressed in the yellow and brown square-patterned fabric with her hands crossed on her chest. She purchases fabric in the neighbouring town, then sews and sells back at at home.

With a loan, she hopes to strengthen her sewing and dying business so as to be able to earn large profits.

She wants to grow the scope of her business in order to better realise a more consistent level of savings and take care of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dressmaking and dying supplies.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles Mbogo is a 22-year-old matatu (privately opened minibus) operator in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He is single and has been operating this business for the past three years. He is doing great. Charles was introduced to Kiva partner KADET and this is his second loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase spare parts for his matatu and use the anticipated profits to buy another vehicle. He plans to own several matatus in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his matatu.

loans.name: Lonise

texts.en:
Lonise is seventy-nine years of age and is a widow with eight children.

Lonise owns & operates a business venture, providing clothing alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Lonise needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2011, Lonise joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lonise's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Rossmery

texts.es:
La socia se sig8e dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes,gallinas y chanchos,la socia los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes,gallinas y chanchos y alimentos para los animales.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rossmerey continues to dedicate herself to raising animals such as guinea pigs, hens, and pigs. She raises and fattens them and then sells them in the different fairs that exist in the district of Anta. Rossmery works at her business from 7:00 am until 6:00 pm. She is advancing her children's wellbeing. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her animals. 

Rossmery is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs, hens, and pigs, and feed for her animals. She is happy about the loan and promises to comply with the schedule of payments.

loans.use: buy guinea pigs, hens, and pigs, and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is sixty-four years of age and is married with five children.

Pauline owns & operates a business venture selling fried foods in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Pauline needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Pauline joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Pauline's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment & tools to expand her business.

loans.name: La Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
Margarita cuenta con 35 años de edad, es casada tiene 5 hijos los cuales están estudiando Luis el mayor esta en 2° se prepa, Tania esta en 1° de prepa, miguel en 2° de secundaria, lucero en 4° de primaria y Jesús en 2° de primaria su esposo se llama José Luis es campesino.

Ella es comerciante tiene la venta de abarrotes tiene una tienda la cual aun no tiene nombre, lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los productos de abarrotes como son: aceites, galletas, leches, huevos, etc. Ella espera que le vaya muy bien con su préstamo y su negocio ya que le esta funcionando muy bien lo sabido sacar adelante.

Margarita pertenece al grupo la santa cruz cuyo nombre es por la colonia  Donde viven el grupo esta integrado por 11 mujeres muy trabajadoras a continuación serán mencionadas: Ma de Jesús, Sonia, Lorenza, Nicolasa, Ma Félix, Elizabeth, Obdulia, Saida, Tania, Luz Divina, Todas Realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de refrescos, comida, ropa, quesos, perfumes, domésticos, abarrotes, etc.

*la señora Ma Felix no se alcanza a ver en la foto, por eso ha sido marcada como si no estuviera
texts.en:
Margarita is 35 years old and is married with 5 children who are studying in school. Luis, the oldest, is in the second year of high school, Tania is in the first year of high school, Miguel is in the second year of middle school, Lucero is in the fourth year of elementary school and Jesús is in the second year of elementary school. Her husband who is a farmer is named José Luis.

She is a merchant who sells groceries. She has a store which still has no name, in which she will invest her loan in the purchase of grocery products, such as: oils, cookies, milks, eggs, etc. She hopes that all goes very well with her loan and her business and as it is works very well she will be able to move it forward. 

Margarita belongs to the group Santa Cruz which is named after the suburb where this group lives that is composed of 11 hard working women that will be listed below: Ma de Jesus, Sonia, Lorenza, Nicolasa, Ma Félix, Elizabeth, Obdulia, Saida, Tania, Luz Divina. All of them work on a commercial activity, such as: the sale of soft drinks, food, clothing, cheeses, perfumes, domestics, groceries, etc.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of grocery products such as:oils, cookies, milks, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Kaps.  He is engaged in raising livestock.  The village of Kaps is favorable for this type of agricultural activity.  Samvel is married with three children: two daughters (eight and fifteen years old) and a nine-year-old son.  He also supports his brother’s family with produce grown on the family farm.  Samvel would like a loan to purchase additional livestock.  According to his business plan, this investment will increase the family income by 20 percent.  He will use some of the additional income to save for his children’s education.


About the Field Partner – AREGAK Universal Credit Organization
In the fall of 1997, United Methodist Committee on Relief (UMCOR) established the AREGAK microfinance program, with the purpose to create economic opportunities for low income people who have no or limited access to the formal financial sources, especially in the remote rural areas. The microfinance program rapidly became one of the largest MFI in Armenia in terms of number of active clients and portfolio size.

In March of 2006, AREGAK UCO was registered as a Universal Credit Organization, structured as a Closed Joint Stock Company with UMCOR as the sole shareholder.
Today, AREGAK UCO provides a broad range of financial services to the population without compromising the social aspects of its mission and continues initiatives geared toward the fulfillment of its ethical principles

Vision Statement
To be the most dynamic and ethical financial institution in Armenia and Nagorno Karabagh.

Mission Statement
AREGAK supports the economic development of small and medium entrepreneurs with high quality, accessible and reliable financial services.

AREGAK UCO’s Ethical Principles
1. Integrity and Excellence
We deliver on our promises
We are honest and transparent in everything we do
We provide excellent customer service
2. Respect and Inclusion
Our leadership, workforce and decision-making reflect and respect the diversity of customers and communities we serve.
We value all employees, investing in their personal and professional growth.
3. Innovation
We develop new processes and systems to improve efficiency
We create value added new products to enhance economic opportunities

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ruth Marina

texts.es: La socia Ruth continua trabajando en la misma Institución privada; ella tambien continua con su negocio alternativo y continua criando animales menores, la socia tiene cuyes y en esta ocasión ella desea invertir el prestamo enla compra de 200 cuyes para incrementar el numero de sus cuyes.
texts.en: Our partner Ruth goes on working for the same private institution. She also goes on with her alternative business and continues breeding small livestock, she has guinea pigs and in this occasion, she wants to invest the loan in buying 200 guinea pigs to increase the number of guinea pigs she owns.

loans.use: making an investment in 200 guinea pigs to increase the number of guinea pigs she owns.

loans.name: Lydian

texts.en:
Lydian is forty years of age and is married with four children.

Lydian owns & operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community.  She has four years of experience in this business.    Lydian needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Lydian joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lydian's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Genny

texts.en:
Genny is 47 years old and married with six children.

Genny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Genny has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from networking for MSE and Natasia.

Genny aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Federita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Federita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Federita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing/fish vending business.

Federita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.en:
Maria Rosa is twenty-three years of age and is married with three children.

Maria Rosa is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.    She needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Maria Rosa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Maria Rosa's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 63 years old and married with seven children.

Lucena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Lucena has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading.

Lucena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old.  She is married and has 7 children.  Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.  Josephine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her 3 children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 63 years old.  She is married and has one child.  Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Letecia has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending. Letecia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom créé depuis le 9 décembre 2010 est composé d'un total de quatorze femmes qui sont issues d'une même famille et sont solidaires entre elles comme l'indique le nom qu'elles ont choisi.Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Coumba la responsable est âgée de 42 ans; elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants. Elle mène une activité de commerce de riz au marché central de la ville avec une expérience moyenne de 3 ans. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en blanc et a levé la main gauche.
Elle se ravitaille au marché auprès des grossistes et revend à ses clients sur place.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter du riz en grande quantité pour ainsi se faire plus de revenus.


Elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille et souhaite avoir sa propre boutique afin d'acheter des quantités significatives de riz.
texts.en:
The Bokk Jom solidarity group was created on Dec. 9th 2010 and is comprised of a total of fourteen women who come from the same family and stand together—as indicated by the name they have chosen.

Coumba, the leader, is 42 years old; she is a married mother of four children.  She runs a business trading rice in the town’s central market, and has had a decent experience for three years now. She is pictured standing on the right of the photo dressed in white and raising her left hand.

She stocks-up on fresh supplies at the wholesalers’ market, and then resells to her clients on-site.

Her loan would be used to purchase rice in large quantities in order to generate more profits.
