texts.es: Evarista de 50 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía de su hijos Maycol al que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca. Su valentía es admirable, cuidó sola de sus 3 hijos, 2 de ellos ya realizaron su vida, tiene familia y siempre velan por la tranquilidad de su madre. Sigue al cuidado de su hijo al que quiere mucho, por ello todos los días de lunes a viernes trabaja en una mina, por la zona alta de al ciudad, ahí extrae oro, plata y cobre. Recibe buen sueldo por ello, esto le permite cubrir sus gastos, cuenta que muchas veces lava los residuos botados de la mina y extrae pequeñas pepas de oro y plata que comercializa a las joyerías de la ciudad, obteniendo de esa manera un dinero extra. Pero como no siempre tiene este ingreso, comenzó con un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de ovejas y granos, los cuales vende a la capital del país los fines de semana cuando descanso de su trabajo. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “chilca” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Evarista de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ovejas para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
50-year-old Evarista is a responsible woman.  She lives together with her son Maycol who she looks after in her own home, which is located in the town of Chilca.  Her courage is admirable as she brought up her three children on her own.  Two of her children are now living independently.  They have their own families and always look out for their mother.  Evarista continues caring for her remaining child who she loves very much.  For this reason, every day from Monday to Friday she works in a mine in the high area of the city.  There she mines gold, silver and copper, and earns a good wage for it.  This allows her to cover her expenses.  She tells us that she often pans the waste products which are thrown out of the mine and extracts small nuggets which she sells to jewelry stores in the city.  This makes her extra money.  However, as she doesn't always have this income, she started a small business buying sheep and grain which she sells in the country's capital city on the weekend when she has a break from her job.

Evarista belongs to the "Chilca' community bank and this is her fourth loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as it will make her feel secure in making progress in her business.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Evarista enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Evarista will invest the money she has requested in buying sheep so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 38 years old, married and blessed with two children.  He has been running a green grocer store for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan of KES 50,000 with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully.  He will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits for his business.  With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into large scale mixed crop farming.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables and fruits for his business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 44 años es una madre responsable. Tiene 2 hijos, pero solo vive con. Yanina, la última hija en casa de su hermana, ubicada en la localidad de Ancalayo. Cuidó de sus hijas, sola, “fue difícil”, comenta pero con la ayuda de su familia pudo salir adelante. Su principal actividad económica es el bordado de fustanes Wanka, que son trajes típicos. Consiste en el bordado a hilo, los cuales vende a 200 nuevos soles, a la semana realiza un promedio de 2 que comercializa en un mercado reconocido de la ciudad. Pero como buena mujer del campo, por temporadas siembra papa y olluco en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, cuenta que en cada cosecha comercializa sus alimentos en la feria de uno de los distritos de la ciudad, donde obtiene buenas ganancias, aprovecha esa oportunidad, para vender los animales que cría entre toros y cerdos. Ahora se encuentra tranquila y con la convicción de sacar profesional a su última hija. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “barrio oriental” y este es el décimo cuarto crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. María de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de telas y paños para el bordado, además de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
44-year-old María is a responsible mother.  She has two children but only lives with Yanina, her youngest daughter.  She lives in her sister's house which is located in the town of Ancalayo.  María raised her daughters alone.  "It was difficult" she says but, with the help of her family, she was able to get by.  Her main business activity is embroidering 'Wanka' underskirts which are traditional clothing.  She embroiders with thread and sells her products for 200 soles.  She makes an average of 2 products a week which she sells in a well-known market in the city.  However, like every good country woman, she also sows potatoes and olluco (a native tuber) on her own farmland.  She says that when she harvests her crops, she sells them in the market in one of the districts of the city, where she makes good profits.  She makes the most of this opportunity to sell the animals that she raises (bulls and pigs).  Right now, María is calm in the knowledge that she will help her youngest daughter become a professional.

María is a member of the 'Barrio Oriental" community bank and this is her fourteenth loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as this will make her feel secure in making progress with her work.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  María enjoys being a member of her community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, María will invest the money she has requested in buying material and cloth for her embroidery.  She will also buy natural fertilizers for her upcoming sowing season.

loans.use: to buy material and cloth, and to buy manure for her crops

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 38-year-old married man and father of two children. He has worked in selling home products for 24 years, but he started his own business in 2010.  Kassem also works in painting homes as an additional income to cover his family's expenses.

Kassem is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for his children's school fees and to increase his business capital with a new collection.

Kassem is a hardworking man and he hopes he can keep on providing his children with the best education and healthiest life ever.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and to increase his business capital with a new collection

loans.name: Maria Emerita

texts.es:
Maria Emérita tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, y tiene 3 hijos que estudian con edades de  12, 8 y 3 años, vive con su familia en la Colonia Monterrey de choloma, cortes.  
Maria Emérita se dedicaba a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora. Hace 4 años que realiza su propia actividad de negocio, donde vende Comidas rápidas, como pollo con tajadas, pastelitos, tacos, baleadas…etc,  y almuerzos. Este negocio le ha generado buenas ganancias de donde ha podido cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hijos. Atiende su negocio su negocio desde las seis de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche.
Ha venido superando en su negocio con préstamo y las  ganancias que ha reinvertido, ahora solicita  un préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida, como harina, frijoles, arroz,  condimento y carnes.
Su plan es mantener una buena clientela  para que su negocio le genere los ingresos necesarios para el hogar y llegar hacer auto sostenible.
texts.en:
Maria Emérita, age 33, is single because she is a widow.  She has three children, ages 12, 8, and 3, and they go to school.  She lives with her family in the Colonia Monterrey in Choloma, Cortes.

Maria Emérita used to sell new and used clothes.  She has always been a very hard-working woman.  She has had her own business for four years.  She sells fast food like chicken with sliced plantains, pastries, tacos, “baleadas” (flour tortillas with beans, eggs, butter, cheese and meat), etc. and lunches.  This business has generated good income, and she has been able to cover her children’s basic necessities.  She sees to her business from six in the morning until eight at night.

Her business has been getting better with the loan and the earnings that she has reinvested in it.  She is now requesting a loan for 15,000 lempiras to buy supplies to make food.  She will buy ingredients like flour, beans, rice, condiments, and meat.

Her plan is to maintain a good clientele so that her business generates the income needed by the household and that it becomes self-sustainable.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, condiments, and meat.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly, de 25 años es una madre responsable. Vive en compañía de Eder, su esposo desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Mariangel y Farid a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Hualahoyo. Su principal trabajo es la fabricación de ladrillos que realiza junto a su esposo. Su trabajo consiste en realizar los moldes para después quemarlos en el horno. Cuenta que al mes realiza 25 millares, los cuales vende a un proveedor conocido que siempre la visita en su fábrica, pero cuando obtiene mejor propuesta lleva a la capital del país a comercializar sus ladrillos. Paralelo a este trabajo siembra maíz y papa en asociación con una señora que posee terrenos agrícolas, se comparten los gastos y a la cosecha se dividen las ganancias. Los alimentos que obtiene los comercializa a la capital, donde lleva también verduras para comercializarlas en el mercado de abastos. Ahora ella desea juntar dinero para comprarse un camión. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “barrio oriental” y este es el décimo tercer crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Magaly, de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de aserrín y arena para realizar los ladrillos.
texts.en:
25-year-old Magaly is a responsible mother.  She lives together with Eder, her husband of 7 years.  The couple have two children, Mariangel and Farid, who they care for in their own home.  Their home is located in the town of Hualahoyo.  Magaly's main job is making bricks.  She carries out this work together with her husband.  Her job consists of preparing the molds which are then fired in the oven.  She says that she makes 25 thousand bricks a month and sells them to a well-known supplier who always visits her factory.  However, when she obtains a better offer, she goes to the country's capital city to sell her bricks.  Alongside this work, Magaly also grows corn and potatoes in partnership with a lady who owns farmland.  They share expenses and, when harvest time comes, they divide the profits.  She sells the crops that she grows in the capital, where she also takes vegetables to sell in the wholesale market.  Right now, Magaly would like to put together some money to buy a truck.

Magaly is a member of the "Barrio Oriental" community bank and this is her thirteenth loan from MFP.  She is happy to know that she will have financial support as it will make her feel secure in making progress in her work.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Magaly enjoys being a member of her community bank because the members are all responsible and supportive people.  With your support, she will invest the money she has requested in buying sawdust and sand to make bricks.

loans.use: to buy sawdust and sand to make more bricks

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 38-year-old married man, father of seven children. He has worked as a taxi driver since two years.

Business is going on just fine but he has to do necessary maintenance for his car. With the help of a requested loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, Mohamad will be capable of doing it.

Mohamad already received an Al Majmoua loan and it helped him a lot in both social and financial situations. He hopes to open a taxi company in the future.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance for his car.

loans.name: Agapitus

texts.en: Agapitus is married and has three children ranging between ten and twenty years of age. He describes himself as a visionary man. For the last five years, he has been involved in selling household necessities such as sugar, flour, sodas, baking flour, "Royco", etc., to residents and students within his home area, which is located near a technical training institute. His business challenge is transportation problems when buying and high prices of goods sold. He will use the loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more sugar, rice and baking flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and baking flour.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 43 years old, married to Mary, and they have three children. He has been in the taxi business for the last eight years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 30,000.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 60,000. He will use the amount to repair his taxi (car). He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits he will repay his loan.

His hopes and dreams are to build rental houses and to educate his children.

loans.use: To repair his taxi (car).

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 42 years old, married to Florence, and they have one child. He has been in the taxi business for the last seven years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 20,000.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 50,000. He will use the funds together with his savings to purchase another taxi. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits he will repay his loan amount.

He also hopes to use the profits to build rental houses and to provide for school fees.

loans.use: To add to his savings and buy another vehicle for his taxi business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 40 years old, married to Lydiah, and they have four children. He has been in the business of operating a public transport vehicle  as well as being a driver for the last five years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 70,000.

He is applying for his second loan with KADEt Ltd of Kes 90,000 He plans to combine the loan funds and his savings to buy another public service vehicle. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With anticipated profits he will repay his loan.

He hopes expand the vehicle transport business and in future buy lorries for transport.

loans.use: To buy another vehicle  for public transport..

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 53-years-old, married to Mwikali and they have four children. He has been in the trading business buying and selling cereals to his customers for the last 4 years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 40,000.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET ltd  of Kes 50,000. He will use the funds to buy stocks of cereals, maize, wheat and beans for sale. He paid the previous loans well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits he will pay fees for his children's education.

His hopes are to expand the business by buying more cereals for sale and to open another branch.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and cereals for sales.

loans.name: Mawar Group

texts.en: Ni Komang succeeded in maintaining her pigs and her husband supported her business because the result can help to improve the family income. She also succeeded in renovating the barn. Now she needs a new loan to purchase piglets and she also has a plan to buy a sow. Because the loan is not enough to purchase it all, her husband gave her money to support the business. She hopes the sow will give her healthy piglets and she can sell them to other breeders in her village. Ni Komang is on the left side, wearing a red shirt.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and a sow.

loans.name: Piter

texts.en:
Piter is a 49-year-old man who is married to Emi, a 43-year-old lady and has been blessed with four children. 
1.	Alfonsus, 21, working 
2.	Oktavianus, 20, working 
3.	Merlyn, 19, studying at a University in Java Island
4.	Jendry, 6, studying in the 1st grade of elementary School

Piter owns a pig raising business. He has been engaged in the business since 2000. He usually purchases piglets at the market and raises them for six months then resells them to customers. His business is growing well. Recently he sold four pigs. The money was used to pay his daughter’s school fees. Currently he has two pigs to be raised. 

Now Piter intends to buy three more piglets to be fattened and feed for them. He needs more capital to do so. Therefore he is requesting a loan of IDR 6,000,000 from TLM. He hopes that TLM will be willing to provide a loan for the improvement of his business.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and feed for them.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 47 years old and is married to Timotius, a 52-year-old farmer. They have been blessed with four children: Dedy, 25 and Barnabas, 18; both are working in Papua; Marselina, 17, is studying in the 3rd grade of Senior High School; Imanuel, 15, is studying in the 2nd grade of Junior High School. 

Susana has been running a kiosk business for two years. It is a small kiosk at home. She sells basic needs such as: cooking oil, coffee, salt, cereal and snacks, and candies for children. The income she earns from the business enables her to help her husband in covering her family's daily needs, even though the income she earns is small. 

Currently Susana dreams of improving her business by adding more stock at her kiosk but she does not have capital to do so. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of IDR 7,500,000 from TLM. This loan will be spent on more kiosk stock such as sugar, rice, biscuits, cigarettes and soft drinks. She also wants to help her husband by providing seedlings and fertilizer for their farm. Susana is expecting that TLM will approve her loan application.

loans.use: to purchase more kiosk stock such as sugar, rice, biscuits, cigarettes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is a 28-year-old married woman with three children; two of them are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for five years.

Yar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a thirty-two-year-old lady from the ShauriYako area of Homabay town, in the West of Kenya. She is married to Omondi and they have two children, aged two and 13 years.

Eunice operates a shoe selling business in Homabay, a business she has done for the last five years making a monthly income of KES. 6,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of shoes for sale. She will use her profits to diversify into farming.

Her dream is to maintain her business for a stable income.

loans.use: To buy a stock of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Takku Liggey est composé de quinze femmes qui sont parentes, voisines et amies qui partagent la même confrérie.Il est créé le 9 décembre 2010, l'activité principale des femmes est le commerce.

Madame Dieumb la responsable est âgée de 45 ans, elle est mariée mère de six enfants dont trois filles, elle a un petit fils en charge; elle mène une activité de commerce de légumes. Elle capitalise une bonne expérience de 23 ans; elle accompagnait son père pour l'aider dans le commerce donc elle a une maitrise parfaite de son activité. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo tout à fait à l'extrême habillée en robe wax avec un châle blanc et a levé la main gauche. 

Elle achéte ses légumes dans une ville maraichère et revend au marché central de sa localité.
Son prêt lui servira à augmenter la quantité et qualité des produits afin de se faire plus de revenus.
Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices subvenir à ses besoins mais également participer à l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Takku Liggey comprises fifteen women who are parents, neighbors, and friends sharing a camaraderie among them. It was created on December 9, 2010. The main work of the women involves commerce.

Ms. Dieumb, the group's official, is 45 years old and the married mother of six children, including three daughters. She has a grandson to support. She has a business selling vegetables and capitalizes on 23 years of good experience. She used to accompany her father to help him in this business, so she has an excellent command of it. She is the one standing at the far right in the photo and wearing a Wax dress with a white shawl; her left hand is raised. 

Ms. Dieumb buys vegetables from a market-garden town and resells them at the central market in her town. Her loan will serve to increase the quantity and quality of her goods, so as to make more revenues. She wishes to use her profits to support herself but also to help her family to thrive.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Urtnasan

texts.en:
Mrs. Urtnasan, 44, runs an auto service center in her backyard. She lives with her husband and her five children in an old wooden house in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For 12 years she has been running her business and usually 2-3 cars are repaired by her in a week. This number is fewer than in other similar services. But her business has been improving slowly day by day. Currently her business income is the main income source of this family. Now she needs to renovate some of her service equipment. 

This will be a very important and beneficial thing for her business in the long run. The loan she is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing auto service equipment for renovation. She said that her service will be expanded as a company in the next two years if she is able.

loans.use: To purchase auto service equipment for renovation.

loans.name: Munkhtulga

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhtulga, 40, works as a service man in a private company. He lives with his wife and his daughter in an apartment which is in a suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Munkhtulga owns an old Japanese car and he does not have a garage for his car. So his car always is parked outside during the year. But this influences his car and its parts badly. Therefore he decided to build a garage near his home by himself. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the necessary building materials to build his new garage.

loans.use: To purchase some necessary building materials to build his new garage.

loans.name: Akuot

texts.en:
Akuot is a 30-year-old married woman with three children; one of them is in school. She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Akuot is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Jonius

texts.en:
Jonius is a 32-year-old man and is married to Feronika, a 26-year-old lady. They are blessed with two children: Windy, 6 years old and attending kindergarten and Sesilia, 3 years old. 

Jonius is working as a part-time librarian at a Public Library nearby his house. He has been working there for one year. In addition to working at the library, Jonius also cultivates vegetables: cucumbers, cassava, papayas, cashews, corn, peanuts and string beans at their farm in his spare time. Jonius is assisted by his wife, Feronika, in taking care their farm and selling the crops as well while he is at the library.
 
Jonius is thinking to improve his business; he wants to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. In addition, Jonius wants to buy firewood to resell at the market. This situation led him to request a loan amounting to IDR 5,000,000 from TLM for his business improvement. He is hoping that TLM will approve his loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, pesticides and firewood as well.

loans.name: Hawah

texts.en: Hawah  is a petty trader. She sells panties and groceries in Adum Banso near Takoradi. Hawah has been in this business for two years now. She is married to a mason and has one child. Hawah uses her income to help her husband to pay their accommodation bill. She will use her loan to purchase panties and a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase panties and a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a thirty-nine-year-old lady from Kakamega town, in the West of Kenya and is married to Francis. They have three children aged between 5 and 17 years.

Florence operates a retail shop in Kakamega, a business she has done for the last six years, making a monthly income of Kes 4,700. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of sugar and cooking fat. She will plow her profits back into her business.

Her dream is to be a successful business lady in Kakamega town.

loans.use: To add more stock of sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Akur

texts.en:
sAkur is a 35-year-old married woman with five children; two of them are in school. he has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for four years.

Akur is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ayar

texts.en:
Ayar is a 28-year-old married woman with four children; none of them are in school. She has had a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Ayar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase onions and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Valeriano

texts.es:
El señor Valeriano tiene en el patio de enfrente de su casa, taller de carpintería. Solicita un préstamo para comprar el materia y construir la losa de concreto y así conectar la casa y el taller y así protegerse del ambiente y también su vivienda ya que es el patrimonio de su familia.
Desea realizar la mejora lo mas pronto posible ya que tiene varios pedidos para entregar y por causa del frio y lluvias no a podido terminar. 
La esposa del señor Valeriano le ayuda con los gastos familiares con su negocio que tiene de dulces, comida y accesorios personales, con las ganancias que obtiene  ambos se hacen cargo de los gastos familiares y escolares.
texts.en:
Sr. Valeriano has a carpenter’s shop in the patio in front of his house. He is applying for a loan to buy the material to build a concrete slab and thus connect the house and the workshop.  This would protect him from the environment and also his home since it is his family’s legacy. 

He wants to make improvements as soon as possible since he has various orders to fill and due to the cold and rains he has not been able to finish them.

Sr. Valeriano’s wife helps him with household expenses with her business selling sweets, food and personal accessories. With the income both receive, they take care of household and school expenses.

loans.use: to construct a concrete slab.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 40-year-old divorced woman who has spent her life taking caring for and raising her children, with the help of her small business that she started 22 years ago. Safaa is a baker. She is specialized in making Lebanese traditional "Saj" bread, almost like pita bread.

Her business is going on just fine, with the support of her customers and with her good quality of products that encourages customers to support her. Safaa is a hardworking mother, who has sacrificed her life for the sake of her children.

She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the first time, to buy necessary raw materials for her business, such as flour and oil, at very good prices. She might also buy living room furniture for her house, because she really needs it.

Safaa is hoping to expand her business more and to open a special bakery in the future.

loans.use: To increase her business inventory with raw materials such as flour and oil.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia, de 48 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Moisés, su esposo desde hace 16 años. Ambos tienen 6 hijos de los cuales solo vive con 3 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Hualahoyo. Ella se siente dichosa de tener el apoyo de su esposo, quien le ayuda cada vez que pueda. Pues la actividad de ambos es la agricultura, mientra sus esposo trabaja como peón, ella se dedica a l cuidado de sus 8 vacas y 3 toros de las cuales extrae la leche que producen para venderlos a los pobladores de su localidad. Su secreto es sembrar por ella misma alfalfa y de esa manera alimenta a su animales, pero siempre les ofrece comida balanceada y vitaminas para mantenerlos fuertes y que produzcan buena leche. Paralelo a este trabajo siembra maíz, papa; en terrenos alquilados, ya cuando es tiempo de la cosecha los comercializa a los compradores mayoristas que buscan el maíz que solo ella sabe producir. Quiere comprar sus propios terrenos y así depender de ella misma. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “barrio oriental” y este es el décimo quinto crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Antonia, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más animales y comida balanceada para alimentarlos.
texts.en: Antonia is 48 years old and a hardworker. She lives with Moisés, her husband of 16 years. They have 6 children, 3 of whom live with them in their own home, located in in the community of Hualahoyo. She feels lucky to have her husband's support. He helps her every time he can. Their activity is farming. While her husband works as a laborer, she takes care of 8 cows and 3 bulls. She extracts the milk the cows produce and sells it to the residents of her community. Her secret is planting her own alfalfa and feeding her animals with it, but she always offers them balanced feed and vitamins to keep them strong and producing good milk. At the same time, she also plants corn and potatoes on rented land. At harvest time, she sells them to wholesalers who seek the corn that only she knows how to grow. She wants to buy her own land and rely only o herself. She belongs to the "Barrio Oriental" community bank. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support, since this way she feels sure she can get ahead in her work. On the other hand, she promises to make her payments. She likes being a part of her association because all of the members are responsible and supportive. If Antonia receives your support, she will invest the money she has asked for in buying more animals and balanced feed to give them.

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam is a 50-year-old Lebanese widow living with her only child, who is working. She works really hard to be able to offer a suitable life for her child. In 2007, she decided to open her own coffee shop. She was really lucky to open her shop in such a location because it’s a place where all people meet. Today, she’s asking for a loan of $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed provisions for her shop such as tea, sugar, Nescafe, and many other items. This investment will improve her business and allow her to serve a wider range of people. In the future, she plans to open new branches in different areas.

loans.use: to purchase needed provisions for her coffee shop.

loans.name: Willis

texts.en:
Willis is a 32-year-old man from the Nyalenda area of Kisumu City. He is married to Maurine, and they have four children.

For the past four years, Willis has operated a clothing business in the Nyalenda area, making a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy children’s clothing, curtains, and ladies' clothes. His profits will be used to educate his children. His dream is to be a wholesale clothing supplier.

loans.use: to buy clothing and curtains to sell.

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is a 43-year-old lady from Homabay town, Western Kenya. Benter, who is widowed, has two children under her care, aged 24 and 18 years.

For the last five years, Benter has operated a cereal-selling business in Homabay, making a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy a stock of beans to sell. She will use her anticipated profits to buy more stocks of beans and maize. Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of beans to sell.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity  is a thirty-six-year-old woman who is married and a mother of two children. She runs a cosmetics shop in Kangemi. Purity has been in the business for four years now and gets a monthly income of fifty-three  thousand  shillings.


This will be Purity’s first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to add more cosmetics to her shop. She wants to plough back the profit she will get into her cosmetics business. 

In future she wants to be able to open two wholesale cosmetic shops in Kinoo and Town.

loans.use: To add more cosmetics to her shop inventory.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is a 30-year-old married woman with four children; two of them are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Roda is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 41-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and five children. Four of them are working and the other one is still attending school. They all cooperate together to enrich their life and live properly. 

Lina started her own home business as a tailor in the year 2000. Today, she needs to borrow $2100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added materials such as textiles for her business. She’s sure that this loan will boost her productivity therefore her sales and thus her revenues.  In the future, she plans to open her own evening dress shop.

loans.use: to purchase added materials such as textiles.

loans.name: Achieng

texts.en:
Achieng is a 28-year-old married woman with six children; four of them are in school. She has had a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Achieng is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 38-year-old lady from Lambwe town, Western Kenya. She is married to Ochieng, and they have six children between the ages of 3 and 18 years.

Dorothy operates an agrochemicals shop in Homabay. She has been in this business for the last five years, making a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more agrochemicals to sell. She will use her profits to open other business outlets. Her dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a stock of agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Moufida

texts.en: Moufida is a 45-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and three children. One of their children is studying and the others are working. To meet the heavy costs of life, Moufida and her husband join forces in order to cover at least their necessary expenses. Moufida has been selling homemade food since 1995. She works from her home upon her customers’ demands. Her husband has owned a van since 2006 and works as a taxi driver. Today, she’s asking to borrow $2600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added provisions for her business. This Kiva loan will facilitate her business operations and allow her to boost her productivity. In the future, she plans to open her own homemade food shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional provisions for her food business.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is 31 years old and a retail shop proprietor in Shanzu, Mombasa. He is single. Katana has been a shopkeeper for the past four years and he is doing great. 

This marks his second business loan from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. He plans to purchase more stock of sugar, cooking fat, washing detergents and rice. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan. He hopes to do well in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, cooking fat, washing detergents and rice

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 36 years old and from Naivasha. He is married to Magdalene and they have five children aged between 15 years and one year old.

Benson has a business of selling charcoal and has been doing it for the past six years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy more sacks of charcoal to add to his stock.

He hopes to expand his business and employ someone to help him run it.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to add to his stock

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is 22 years old and a married woman with one child who is not in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for one year.

Achol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Hachem

texts.en:
Hachem is a 54-year-old divorced man, who has spent his whole life taking care of his three children. He was father, mother and friend all at the same time.

Hachem is a hardworking man, sacrificing himself for his children's best interests. He has owned a specialty home products and gift shop since 1995. It's his only source of income and that's why he invests a lot in it to give him back what he's seeking.

Hachem's shop needs some necessary maintenance to be done, in addition to expanding his product range with a new released collection, and that's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to obtain requested needs.

It's his fourth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he describes his experience as a smart step taken to move forward. He hopes to keep on improving his business as much as he can.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his shop, and to expand his product range with a new collection.

loans.name: Ada Nohemy

texts.es:
La señora Ada Nohemy esta casada y es madre de tres hijos, su esposo le apoya economicamente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, Ada Nohemy se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de calzado y cosmeticos, sus ventas son de manera ambulante, hace los pedidos del producto y luego los distribuye en las casas de sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de calzado para dama. 
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio para tener mayores ganancias.
desea darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ada Nohemy is married and the mother of three children.  Her husband helps her financially to cover the household expenses.  Ada Nohemy has worked for two years selling shoes and cosmetics on foot.  She takes requests for the products and later delivers them to her customers' homes.

She will use the loan to buy women's shoes.

Her goal is to make her business grow so she will have bigger profits.  She wants to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 57 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Camilo, su esposo desde hace 36 años. Ambos tienen 10 hijos, pero solo viven con 5 de ellos en su Casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ancala. La actividad a la que se dedica está esmerada mujer es el bordado de hojas para las faldas y fustanes típicos que usan las personas en festividades del valle, principalmente para el baile del huaylas. Su trabajo consiste en el bordado, que se tarde un promedio de 2 meses, pero si realiza con constancia y ayuda lo termina en un mes. Cada bordado lo comercializa a buen precio, pues requiere de paciencia, tiempo y creatividad. Cuenta que sus hijas le ayudan, pues de esa manera ayudan a su mana en vender más bordados y obtener más ganancias y también en enseñar la tradición familiar. Mientras que su esposo trabaja como albañil construyendo casa, su ganancias se base en contratos, mientras más rápido termine más ganancias tiene. Ahora desea mejorar sus bordados y ser reconocida en su localidad. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “mollecito” y este es el decimosegundo crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Betty, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de hilos, telas y adornos para su bordado.
texts.en: Betty is 57 years old. She is a cheerful woman. She lives with Camilo, her husband of 36 years. They have 10 children, but only 5 of them live with them in their own home, located in the community of Ancala. This dedicated woman's activity is embroidering leaves on traditional skirts and slips people use in the valley festivals, mainly for the Huaylas dance. Her job is the embroidery, which takes an average of 2 months, but if she works constantly and gets help she can finish in a month.  She sells each piece of embroidery at a good price, because it requires patience, time and creativity. She remarks that her daughters help her, and this helps their mother to sell more embroidery and make more profit, as well as teach the family tradition. While her husband works as a bricklayer building houses, her work is by contract. The faster she finishes, the more she makes. Now she wants to improve her embroidery and become well known in her community. She belongs to the "Mollecito" communal bank and this is her twelfth loan with MFP. She is very happy there knowing she has financial support, since it makes her feel safe going forward in her work. She promises to make her payments and is happy to be apart of the association because all of the members are responsible and hardworking. If Betty receives your support, she will invest the money she has asked for in buying thread, fabric and decorations for her embroidery.

loans.use: to buy thread and decorations to do embroidery.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 31-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He strives to work hard in order to pay his children’s study fees. 

In 2006, he opened his own restaurant where people can meet and have a good time. His business has grown fast and he is looking forward to further expanding his business. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase products such as soft drinks, food and many other items. He notes that this will help him attract more customers and therefore increase his revenue. In the future, he plans to diversify his products by adding seafood to his menu.

loans.use: to purchase products such as soft drinks, food and many other items.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 43 years old, married and has three children.

Iman has been a tailor since 2000. She makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally, things such as suits, coats and trousers for women and kids. She has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting a $2,000 loan to rent a boutique store to display the clothing. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to rent a boutique store to display clothing

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 32 years old. She is a married mother of two children aged eight and six years old. She has a mobile boutique and has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She will use the loan to add to the stock of clothes for her business.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by KADET Ltd. staff. She hopes to venture into a farming business in future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has three children.

Saddam has been an owner of a bakery since 2008. He produces and sells flour-based foods baked in oven such as bread, cakes, pastries and pies. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $1800 loan in order to purchase a large dough mixer. He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a large dough mixer.

loans.name: Nyankuany

texts.en:
Nyankuany is a 25-year-old married woman with three children; all of them are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for four years.

Nyankuany is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne Wanjiru is a 33-year-old business lady in Mombasa. She makes yoghurts and fresh juices to sell. She is married. She has been doing this business for the last three years with success. 

This is Anne’s first business loan from KADET to finance her business. She plans to purchase sugar, food coloring, milk, fresh fruit  and  a refrigerator.

She will use the anticipated profits to  repay her loan and to open another business. She hopes to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, food coloring, milk  and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Abduhakim

texts.ru: Абдухаким проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 53 года. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Абдухаким занимается скотоводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается 14 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Abduhakim lives in the city of Vahdat.  He is 53 years old, married and has two children.  Abduhakim is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds cattle at home.  He has been in this business for 14 years.  Abduhakim is requesting this loan to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan is a 38-year-old Lebanese man living with his wife and two children, who are still attending school. He has owned a juice shop in his town for the past eight years. He spends most of his time working, but in the end he knows that he’s offering a fair way of living for his family, and this is what he cares about most. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of fresh fruits for his business. He notes that this will improve his business and thus his economic situation. In the future, he plans to expand his business and open a coffee shop.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruits for his business.

loans.name: Conrada

texts.en:
Conrada is 63-year-old married woman with 6 children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Conrada has had a sari-sari store for 10 years. She sells items like coffee, shampoo, soap, vinegar, cooking oil, and canned goods. Conrada earns about 4500 PHP per month with her business, which enables her to help provide for her family's daily needs.

Conrada has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, and noodles. She hopes her business will grow bigger.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Mahmatkhon

texts.ru: Махматхон проживает в районе Фархор. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он уже четыре года занимается торговлей. У него имеется продуктовый магазин. Он привозит продукты с города Душанбе. Кредит берет для покупки вафель, кондитерских и колбасных изделий.
texts.en: Mahmatkhon lives in the Farkhor district.  He is 42 years old, married and has four children.  He has been involved in sales for four years.  He owns a food market.  Mahmatkhon delivers his products from the city of Dushanbe.  He is requesting this loan to purchase waffles, confectionery and sausage goods.

loans.use: to buy waffles, confectionery and sausage goods

loans.name: Sunatullo

texts.ru: Сунатулло житель города Вахдат. Ему 24 года. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Сунатулло предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он три года. Целью получения кредита является установка оборудования для природного газа.
texts.en: Sunatullo is a resident of the city of Vahdat.  He is 24 years old, married and has one child.  Sunatullo provides a taxi service and has been in this business for three years.  The goal of obtaining this loan is to install natural gas equipment.

loans.use: to install natural gas equipment

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Хабибулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Он женат. Ему 29 лет. У него один ребенок. Он занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается семь лет. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Habibullo lives in the city of Vahdat.  He is 29 years old, married and has one child.  He is involved in animal husbandry and has been in this business for seven years.  Habibullo is requesting this loan to purchase a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Namozboy

texts.ru: Намозбой проживает в районе Фархор. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Namozboy lives in the Farkhor district.  He is 53 years old, married and has four children.  He earns a living by breeding cattle.  Namozboy is requesting this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Eva Julia

texts.es:
la sra. Eva tiene 66 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos pero ninguno de ellos dependen de ella, es viuda y su actividad principal es la renta de cuartos, actividad que tiene más de 16 años de realizarla,  su cuartería se ubica en su casa de habitación,  Doña Eva a sabido aprovechar cada uno de los créditos que a solicitado, a construido nuevos cuartos, a ido haciendo reparaciones en su casa, es notorio los arreglos efectuados lo que le ha permitido cambiar la estética de su cuartería y que le facilita subirle a la renta a sus inquilinos.
Nos esta solicitando el credito para seguir haciendo mejoras en su cuartería.
texts.en:
Eva, 66, is the mother of four children, but none of them are dependent on her.  She is a widow and her principal work is renting rooms, a job she has been doing for more than 16 years.  Her housing is located in her home.

Eva knew how to make the most of each one of the loans she has requested.  She built new rooms and made repairs to her house.  It's obvious that the repairs made have allowed her to change the aesthetic of her rooming house and that they facilitate raising her tenants' rent.

She is requesting the loan from us to continue making improvements to her housing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a 38-year-old farmer in Voi. She is a married mother of four. She has been selling farm produce successfully for the past four years. 

This marks Luvuno's third loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase a bigger plot of land to do her farming. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. She hopes a have a happier, well-cared-for family.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger plot of land.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 27 años de edad, es un joven padre de familia. Vive en compañía de Ani, su esposa, ambos tienen una hija pequeña, Maricielo a la que quieren en una casa alquilada ubicada en la ciudad de Chilca. Él nació en la ciudad de Huancayo, pero sus padres son del campo, por ello se siente orgulloso de ellos. Le enseñaron a trabajar muy duro, su principal objetivo es construir su casita en un terreno que heredó de su madre en la ciudad. Por ello comenzó a trabajar en el trasporte, cubriendo las rutas de Huancayo hacia la ciudad de Huancavelica, cuenta que realiza de uno a dos viajes, ganando muy bien por cada uno de ellos. Pero como su esposa es una mujer trabajadora y le ayuda en lo que puede, realiza pequeñas artesanías, que consiste en la realización hombres pequeños a base de alambres e hilos, al día realiza un millar de ellos, recibiendo buen pago por su trabajo. Ahora desea manejar ómnibus más grande para eso necesita una nueva licencia de conducir, obteniéndola, podría ganar mucho más y de esa manera cumplir con su objetivo. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “chila” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Carlos de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de los trámites para su licencia en el manejo de carros mucho más grandes.
texts.en: Carlos, 27, is a young father.  He lives with his wife, Ani, and their daughter, Maricielo--who they dearly love--in a rented house in Chilca.  Carlos was born in the city of Huancayo, but his parents are from the country and he’s proud of them for that.  Carlos has always worked hard.  His plan is to build a small house on a plot of land in the city, left to him by his mother.  He started his taxi business to raise the money he needs.  He drives the route between Huancayo and the city of Huancavelica, a trip that he makes once or twice [a day, a week?—not clear] and he’s happy with his earnings from the business.  His wife has a crafts business, turning wire and thread into human figures.  She makes around a thousand of the figures a day and is well paid for her work.  Carlos wants to drive larger buses, but he needs a new set of licensing and it’s expensive to get.  He could earn a lot more with it, though, and that’s why he’s applying for this loan.   He belongs to the Chila community bank and this is his first MFP loan.  He was pleased to learn about this means of financing because the money will allow him to grow his business.  He, in turn, agrees to repay the loan in the agreed-upon time.  He likes his community bank because the members are responsible and supportive.  Carlos, upon receiving your loan, will pay for the licensing he needs to grow his taxi business.

loans.use: to get required licensing for his taxi business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 45-year-old lady from Kisumu City, situated along the shores of Lake Victoria. She is married to Dicken, and they have five children between the ages of 18 and 30 years.

Alice operates a business renting out chairs and tents in Nyalenda. She has been in this business for the last 10 years, making a monthly income of KES 30,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more chairs and tents. She will use her profits to expand her business. Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy tents and chairs for her rental business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a modest 40-year-old lady from the Nyalenda area of Kisumu City. She is married to a businessman, Victor, and they have two young children.

Judith operates a food stall in Nyalenda. She has been in this business for the past year. In a month, she makes a profit of KES 6,000. She is in her first loan cycle with KADET LTD, and she will use the loan to buy foodstuffs like maize and beans.

Her profits will be used to educate her children. Her dream is to open a hotel [restaurant].

loans.use: to buy maize and beans.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny, de 35 años es una joven responsable. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Chilca. Su única responsabilidad es mantener a sus padres tranquilos. Por ello trabaja sin descanso en la compra y venta de ovejas pequeñas, que es su especialidad. Su trabajo consiste en viajar a la altura donde crían los animales, para comprar a los ganaderos por cantidad, ella misma los traslada a la ciudad donde los comercializa a las diferentes ferias del valle. Le va muy bien en su trabajo por ello se siente realizada, ya que desde muy joven comenzó este trabajo cada año obtiene mejores clientes y por ende mejores ganancias. Los meses que tiene más ingresos son desde marzo a septiembre, que los pobladores se alistan para la época festiva en conmemoración de los animales. Ahora desea consolidarse en su negocio.  Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “chilca” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.  Marleny, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ovejas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Marleny, 35, is a responsible young woman.  She lives with her parents and siblings, whom she cares for in her own home, located in the city of Chilca.  Her only responsibility is to keep her parents calm, for which she works without rest buying and selling young sheep, which is her specialty.

Her job consists of traveling to the altitude at which they raise the animals, to buy large quantities from the ranchers.  She herself transports them to the city where she sells them at the various markets in the valley.  Her job is going very well for her, for which she feels fulfilled because she started this job when she was very young.  Every year she gets better customers and, as a result, better profits.  The months from March to September are when she has the most income, since the residents are getting ready for the holiday season in commemoration of the animals.  Now she wants to grow in her business.

She belongs to the Chilca solidarity group, and this is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have some financial help because in this way she feels secure about making progress with her business.  On the other hand, she promises to make the payments on time.  Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.

If she receives your support, Marleny will invest the requested money in buying sheep for her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.es:
Primitivo, de 60 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso con muchas ganas de progresar. Está separado de la madre de sus hijos, pero vive en compañía de ellos en su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Primitivo es el cultivo de yucas y plátanos, productos que los vende vende en los mercados de su localidad, asimismo tiene para su consumo personal. Además de tener sembríos de palma aceitera contando para eso con un terreno de 20 hectáreas que lo adquirió hace 50 años, tiempo que viene ejerciendo este oficio. Por otro lado sus hijos lo apoyan en la cosecha,  compartiendo las ganancias. Le gusta su negocio pues lo conoce muy bien ya que lleva muchos años dedicándose a éste trabajo y dicha experiencia la está pasando a sus hijos. Las ganancias que le deja, ha sabido administrarlo para procurar que no les falte nada a sus hijos. Por lo contario, lo que no le gusta es que la lejanía de su ubicación ha demorado en llegar los servicio básico como la luz eléctrica, pero con los nuevos programas eso se está logrando mejorar. Ahora tiene los deseos de ampliar su negocio y dejar a sus hijos con algo seguro para sus futuro. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Ademas de estar bien con su banco comunal pues conoce a la mayoría de sus integrantes y los considera buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de abono para la producción de palma así como el pago de personal para la cosecha de sus productos.
texts.en:
Primitivo, 60, is a diligent, hard-working man with a strong drive to get ahead.  He is separated from the mother of his children, but they still live together in a house that he owns.
Primitivo has a farming business.  He grows yucca and platanos and sells what he doesn’t need for his own use at a local market.  He also produces palm oil on 20 hectares of land that he bought 50 years ago, when he first began farming.  His children help him harvest his crop and he shares his earnings with them.  He likes the business and knows it well because he’s worked at it for many years, and he’s now passing what he knows along to his children.  He has learned to manage any money that he has left to better provide for his children.  He lives too far out, he says, to receive basic services like electricity, but there are new programs in place that he hopes will deliver better services in the future.  Primitivo is a new borrower and this is his first MFP loan.  He is counting on your support to help him continue his business.  He likes his community bank because he knows most of the members and considers them to be good people.  
He will use this 800 new soles loan to buy organic manure to produce palm and to pay day laborers to help him harvest his crop.

loans.use: to pay for day laborers and buy supplies for his farming business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Gantulga is 50 years old and lives with his wife, Otgon, and 2 sons in western Mongolia. His wife works as a decorator in a construction business during the summer. His sons study at the local secondary school. He has been running a welding business from his home since 2000. Over the years, he has established a well-known service in the area and has gained regular customers. Based on his experience, he decided to expand his equipment so that he can supply more services and save for his sons' college fees.  He is a really intelligent guy who says, "I would like to extend my business by getting some necessary tools with help from you." The total amount he is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to purchase welding materials.

loans.use: to purchase materials for welding

loans.name: Ding

texts.en:
Ding is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. For two years, she has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan.

Ding is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ajak

texts.en:
Ajak is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. For three years, she has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan.

Ajak is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Armanda

texts.es:
En la parroquia Charapoto del cantón Sucre en la Provincia de Manabí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 16, 12, 11, 7 y 2 años de edad, los dos  mayores estudian en colegio y los dos siguientes en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta  de frutas y legumbres en su casa donde tienen  un pequeño local, su esposo se levanta bien de mañana para ir al mercado de mayoristas y comprar a los agricultores que llegan con sus productos desde el campo,   luego lleva los productos a su local para venderles a sus clientes.  Con lo poco que tenían empezaron este negocio y así lo han mantenido ya por  9 años y gracias a esto ellos  han podido sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito lo van a emplear en comprar frutas y legumbres  para la  venta, está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución. 

Sus sueños seguir adelante por el bienestar de  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Virgen de Guadalupe Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the parish of Carapoto in the canton of Sucre in the province of Manabí.  This area is known for its traditional culture as well as for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Rosa lives in this location.  She is 31 years old and maintains a common-law relationship in which she has five children, ages 16, 12, 11, 7, and 2.  The two oldest are studying in high school and the next two in elementary school.  Her husband is a storekeeper.

She and her husband work selling fruits and vegetables in their home, where they have a small store.  Her husband gets up very early to go to the wholesale market to buy from the farmers who come from the country with their products.  Then he takes the products to his place to sell to their customers.  They began this business with the little they had, and in this way they have supported it for nine years already.  Thanks to this they have been able to get their family ahead.

She is going to use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

She has been with the communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because of the help the institution offers her.  Her dream is to get ahead for the well-being of her children.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora con muchas ganas de progresar. Está separada del padre de sus hijos, pero vive en compañía de ellos, habitando en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Jacinta es la venta de pollos, para eso pone todos los días una mesa en el frontis de su casa, donde prepara los pollos para la venta. Estos animales los compra vivos de la granja de su hermano, quien le vende a precio preferencial, para luego beneficiarlos para su venta. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 06 años, y y hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien, además cuetna con el apoyo de sus hijos. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones, tanto personales como económicas ya que le ha permito pagar los estudios de su hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo. Las ganancias económicas que le deja, los ahorra pues tiene plan abrir una bodega de abarrotes en su casa, de esa manera se generará más ingresos económicos. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se siente bien con su banco comunal pues los conspira un grupo unido. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra pollos para la venta en su negocio, y con el saldo comprará abarrotes para iniciar su negocio de bodega.
texts.en:
Jacinta, 42, is a diligent, hard-working woman with a strong drive to get ahead.  She is separated from the father of her children, but they all still live together in a shared house.  
Jacinta has a poultry business.  She sets up a table in front of her house where she prepares chickens for sale.  Her brother raises the chickens on his farm and sells them to her at a discounted price.  She has operated the business for almost 6 years and she’s happy with her progress.  She says, too, that she can rely on her children to help her with the business.  She likes owning her own business, not only because she can pay to send her children—her pride and joy—to school, but also because the business has brought her great personal satisfaction.  She saves everything that she can because she wants to open a corner grocery in her house, a business that she thinks will significantly increase her earnings.  This will be her third MFP loan and she is counting on your support to meet her goals.  She likes her community bank, she says, because the members support one another.  
Jacinta will use part of this 2000 new soles loan to buy chickens for her poultry business and the rest to stock her new grocery business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for her poultry business and to stock her new grocery business.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 35 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Francisco quien es empleado, fruto de esa unión tienen 05 hijos y juntos habitan en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Lidia es la venta de comida rápida como salchipapas, juanes, y otros, es así que todos los días instala en un esquina de su localidad, su freidora, mesas y sillas, y atiende amablemente  a sus clientes. Contando con el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes le apoyan en la preparación y atención al cliente. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de su hogar y apoyar a su pareja. Por lo contario agota guerzas el instalar y desinstalar su puesto de venta, por eso quisiera alquilar un local donde tendría todo listo para la atención a sus clientes. Ahora ve que las ganancias son buenas y cotando con el apoyo de su pareja tiene planes de alquilar un local y colocar más mesas y sillas. Por tanto éste sería el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, por lo que espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mesas y sillas, así como ingredientes para la preparación de su comida.
texts.en:
Lidia, age 35, is a hard-working and determined woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She lives with Franscisco, who is employed.  They have five children, and they live together in their own house.

Lidia sells fast food like “salchipapas” (fried potatoes and fried sausages), “juanes”  (a traditional chicken and rice meal), and others.  Every day she sets herself up on her corner with her fryer, tables, and chairs, and she kindly waits on her customers.  She has help from her children; they help with the preparation and with waiting on the customers.

She likes her business; it generates income to cover the household expenses and helps her life partner.  On the contrary, it exhausts her to set up and take down her stall.  That is why she would like to rent a place where everything would be ready to take care of her customers.

Now, seeing that her income is good, and counting on the support of her life partner, she has plans to rent a place and set up more tables and chairs.  

This would be her first loan with MFP.  She is hoping for a small loan in order to be able to reach her objectives.  She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy tables, chairs, and ingredients to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and ingredients to prepare her food.

loans.name: Imperial Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “IMPERIAL” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eulalia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de enaguas y polleras, venta de comida, venta de tejidos, venta de golosinas, tejidos de chompas, taller de tejido, fabrica de pipocas, tejido de mantas.

La señora Eulalia,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución voluntariamente. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de polleras e enaguas que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo, aprendiendo este oficio en un instituto de formación.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de telas y centros) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio comercial. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y los ahorros.

El la fotografía no esta presente la señora rebeca por razones culturales.
texts.en:
The communal association 'Imperial' is starting their first cycle with 'Pro Mujer', as a part of the larger group 'Santiago II'. The group is made up of seven members and is lead by a board of directors, in which Eulalia is the treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal association are involved with are varied and include: sewing skirts and petticoats, selling food, selling woven products, selling snacks, weaving sweaters, a weaving shop, making popcorn and weaving cloth.

Eulalia told us that it is the first time that she has worked with 'Pro Mujer' and that she joined the organization voluntarily. She has a business where she sews skirts and petticoats. She has been working in this for some time now. She learned how to do this work in a training institute.  

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase her capital to buy fabrics and ribbons. She will buy her supplies and later after making her products will sell them in her commercial space. This small business allows her to make income to help support her family. She is a single mother of two children. 
 
When we asked her what she likes most about 'Pro Mujer', she said she likes the trainings about savings. 

In the picture Rebeca is not present for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy cloth and ribbons.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has two children.

Haydar has been an owner of a sweet shop since 1993, making a number of types of regional specialties sweets. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to purchase a sweet-making machine and to add more tables to his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase a sweet-making machine and to add more tables to his shop.

loans.name: Deivis

texts.es: Deivis de 20 años de edad es un joven negociante, que se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios y al mantenimiento  y reparación de estos. Su experiencia data desde hace 2 años, cuando   su tío le enseñó el oficio, al que posteriormente se dedicó por su propia cuenta y con su esfuerzo propio en una terraza de una vecina. En la actualidad tiene la  meta de tener un local estructurado con mayor amplitud, en el que sus clientes encuentren un ambiente confortable y esto es lo que está planeando muy pronto con su familia. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el   comprará celulares modernos, carcazas y baterías, para ofrecer una venta más actualizada a sus clientes y lograr aumentar sus inventarios y atraer su potencial clientela. En la actualidad sus indicadores financieros muestran una rentabilidad promedia de un 55,58%, mientras sus inventarios rotan cada 38 días; desde este panorama financiero inicia Deivis su ascenso, en su crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en: Deivis is a young businessman, only 20 years old, and already has his own cell phone business.  He sells cell phones and cell phone accessories and also maintains and repairs them.  He learned the business from his uncle 2 years ago and then set up his own business on a neighbor’s terrace.  His goal, now, is to open a shop where he can display more products and attract more customers, a goal that he hopes to meet soon with help from his family.  This Kiva loan is the first that Deivis will receive from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy the latest cell phones and cell phone accessories he needs to stock his business.  He knows that expanding the range of products he sells will help him attract more customers.  His business plan indicates an average profit of 55.58% and an inventory turnover of 38 days.  Deivis is off to a good start toward his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur and now he wants to grow and grow.

loans.use: to stock her cell phone business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish for sale.

loans.name: G.s Manantial Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está conformado por tres emprendedoras que son de la misma localidad donde habitan, cada una de las emprendedoras tienen su propio negocio, su objetivo de ellas al formar parte de este grupo es para motivarse entre ellas y salir adelante cada una con los  negocios. Este grupo solidario está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en los negocios. Martha Elena es una emprendedora que tiene su negocio de la venta de cosméticos y variedad de mercadería en general, ella está solicitando financiamiento para comprar variedad de ropa, cosméticos como pinturas, polvo, lápiz labial, crema, lápiz de ojo entre otros cosméticos.
