Esperanza has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 5 years. She requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Esperanza has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Esperanza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Noche

texts.en:
Noche is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Noche provides motorcycle transport services.  He has had this business for 5 years.  He requests a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Noche has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Noche hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Fe has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 4 years. She requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single with no children.  

She operates a bakery in a shop that she rents. She also gets some extra income from teaching.  She has been in this business for the last 2 years. She works seven days a week. 

Mary has requested a loan of 800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, flour and cooking oil.  Her major business challenges are transportation and on and off electricity.  

Her aspirations and goals are to build a house and own a big bakery.  She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Angeles has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for 6 years.  Angeles requests a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy bananas to sell.

Angeles has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Angeles hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Elvira has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 6 years.  She requesta a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sell.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Ines has a shop that sells home appliances and furniture.  She has had this business for 10 years.  She requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy home appliances and furniture for sell.

Ines has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ines hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of home appliances & furniture for sell.

loans.name: Annielou

texts.en:
Annielou is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Annielou has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 14 years.  She requesta a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Annielou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Annielou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Helen has a shop that sells vegetables like Chinese cabbage.  She has had this business for 2 years.  She requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future,Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Ruben is provides motorcycle transport services. He has had this business for 2 years. He requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

Ruben has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ruben hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline.

loans.name: Majorie

texts.en:
Majorie is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Majorie has a shop that sells fish, like sardines and trout.  She has had this business for 2 years.  She requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Majorie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Majorie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 ears old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Jocelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 2 years.  She requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sell.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr S.

texts.en:
Abu Bakarr, 57, is a primary school teacher in Makeni.  Abu was born in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone.  He is married and has five children who attend primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. 

Abu Bakarr has served in the teaching profession for forty years.  He requests this loan in order to pay school fees for his children. 

Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org base in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleases to present Abu Bakarr to you.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Erlinda has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 12 years.  She requests a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sell.

loans.name: Jose Reynaldo

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, vive con su familia, tiene casa propia, lleva 10 años de estar dedicado a la agricultura, lo aprendió de su familia, y hoy en día se defiende con esta ocupación, para mantenerse ocupado y de la cosecha poder comercializarla y generar ingresos económicos.
Él solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo para el pago de alquiler del terreno, compra de abono, para iniciar la siembra, este préstamo le ayudara para tener seguridad del terreno y además comprarse los insumos necesarios para aplicarlos al cultivo.
Él tiene su objetivo y es que quiere tener una cosecha abundante, mejorando la producción, para poder tener la oportunidad de vender, ya que así es como obtiene las ganancias, de lo poco que le queda.
texts.en:
José is a farmer.  He lives with his family and has his own house.  He has worked in agriculture for ten years.  He learned it from his family, and today he takes care of himself with this job, to keep himself busy and to sell the harvest and generate income.

He is requesting a loan to pay the rent on his land and to buy fertilizer to start the planting.  This loan will help him to have confidence about the land and also to buy himself the necessary supplies to apply to the crop.

His goal is to have an abundant harvest, improving the production, to be able to have the opportunity to sell it.  That is how he gets his profit from the little that remains for him.

loans.use: to pay the rent on his land.

loans.name: Abass I.

texts.en:
In the photo above is Abass. Abass is a primary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone.  The fifty-seven year old has served in the teaching profession for twenty-seven years.

A native of Pet-Banna village, in northern Sierra Leone, Abass is married, and the couple has four children: three attend primary school and one is in college.  

Abass has requested this loan from SMT/Kiva lenders to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with three children who attend school. 

She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis.  She has been in this business for the last 8 years. She works seven days a week. 

Maureen has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas.  Her major business challenges are transportation of bananas from the Ntinda market to her stall, in Kigowa,  and thieves. 

Her aspirations and goals are to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land.  She lives in rented house and family has access to piped water but no electricity.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Albert D.

texts.en:
Albert is a primary school teacher in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.  Albert is thirty-two years old, single with two primary school going children. 

Albert has been a teacher for eight years.  He has requested this loan to pay his college fees.  Albert will repay his Kiva loan, using his monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay his college fees.

loans.name: Hawa U.

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo above is Hawa, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone.  Hawa has been a professional teacher for twenty-seven years.  

A native of Rokulan village near Makeni, Hawa  is 51 years old.  She is married to a civil servant and the couple has two children.  

Hawa has requested a loan to buy house building materials, like iron corrugated zinc, sand, nails, cements, etc. for the construction of a house.  At the end of each month, Hawa will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to buy house building materials for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with three children, and all go to school.  She takes care of additional family members (sister).  

She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis.  Rose has been in this business for the last 1.5 years.  She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to more bags of charcoal.  Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her aspirations and goals are to become a wholesaler and to build rental houses.  She lives in her own house and the family does not have access to piped water nor electricity.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Rosaline T.

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo above is Rosaline, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone.  Rosaline has been a professional teacher for thirty-two years.  A native of Bombali district, in northern Sierra Leone, Rosaline is a widow with three children; two are in college.  

Rosaline has requested this loan to pay her children’s college fees and to buy house building materials for the completion of a house she is building.  At the end of each month, Rosaline will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay her children’s college fees and to buy house building materials for the completion of a house she is building.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un señor de 61 años de edad, el cual vive con su familia, en la comunidad de Canalette, en la región de Upala, San Carlos en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta provincia ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas, una de las principales zonas ganaderas del país especialmente a través de la producción del cantón de San Carlos. Además en la provincia se asientan las plantas procesadoras de leche de la Cooperativa de Productores de Leche Dos Pinos, propiedad de miles de productores de leche. 
Además en la zona alrededor de la ciudad de Alajuela se ha asentado gran cantidad de empresas manufactureras de exportación. En Alajuela operan las zonas francas de El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos y Bet. 

Desde hace ocho años que Juan se dedica a la agricultura, para continuar su negocio, le hace falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados.  

Actualmente Juan está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢600.000 (seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de insumos varios para darle mantenimiento a su finca y pagar unos gramos de semilla de maíz que había solicitado. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio, ya que su meta es poder continuar con su trabajo donde pueda mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Juan es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Canalette, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Juan is 61, and lives with his family in the community of Canalette, in the Upala region, in San Carlos canton, Alajuela province. This province is first in the nation in the production of coffee and sugar cane. In addition, it produces staple grains (rice, beans, corn), fruit, legumes, tubers, and vegetables. It is one of the main cattle-producing areas of the country, especially with the production of San Carlos canton. 

As well, the milk-processing plants of the Dos Pinos Milk Producers Cooperative, which belongs to thousands of milk producers, are located here. Also, a large number of export manufacturing companies have been established in the area around the city of Alajuela. The duty-free zones of El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos, and Bet, operate in Alajuela. 

Juan has been farming for eight years. To continue his business, he needs working capital so that his business can grow, and members of his community benefit.

Now Juan is applying for a loan of 600,000 colones to buy various agricultural supplies, in order to maintain his small farm, and pay for a few kilos of seed corn that he had ordered.  With this, he hopes to make his business grow, as his goal is to be able to continue his work, through which he can greatly improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Juan is a member of the Canalette communal bank, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and with it he hopes to continue growing in financial terms, and as a person, and also participate actively in his community's communal bank.

loans.use: To grow corn.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su hijo, es madre soltera, es comerciante de ropa, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, con el apoyo de su hijo, ya que siempre está a su lado, no tiene un horario establecido ya que vende en distintas zonas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa, blusas, faldas, ropa interior, entre otras que son demandadas, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, ampliando y atrayendo a más clientes.
La aspiración de Rosa es montar el negocio en un lugar accesible, fijo, con un local que le sirva de atracción para mejorar sus ventas, además quiere que su hijo sea su apoyo y tambien se vea beneficiado con el crecimiento del negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her son and is a single mother. She is a shopkeeper and established this business of her own initiative, with the support of her son who is always by her side. She does not have a fixed schedule as she sells clothing in different areas.

At present, she requests a loan to purchase clothing: blouses, skirts and undergarments, among other things that have been requested by her customers. This investment will help her improve her business, expanding and attracting more customers. 

Rosa's aspiration is to set up the business in an accessible and permanent location that will attract more customers and improve her sales. Moreover, she wants her son to assist her and benefit from the growth of the business.

loans.use: purchase clothing: blouses, skirts and undergarments.

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con sus hijos, todos están adultos, su ocupación es una granja de pollos, que la administra desde hace 15 años, este oficio es de su agrado y no tiene un horario fijo para atenderlo, pues como esta en la casa, atiende las ocupación del hogar al mismo tiempo que la granja.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de concentrado y compra de materiales para reparación de la granja, como maya, madera, clavos, para darle mas fuerza, que este más segura para los pollo, este préstamo le ayudara a cubrir el gasto, mejorando el negocio.
Su objetivo es tener más ganancias y por eso recurre al préstamo, para encontrar la manera de ser más productivos.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her children, all of whom are adults.  Her job is a chicken farm she has run for 15 years.  This job is to her liking, and she does not have a fixed schedule to take care of it.  Since she is at home, she takes care of the household at the same time as the farm.

She is requesting a loan to buy concentrated feed and materials to repair the farm, such as mesh, wood, and nails, to make it stronger and more secure for the chickens.  This loan will help her cover the expense, improving the business.

Her goal is to have more profit, so she is turning to the loan, to find the way to be more productive.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and materials: mesh, wood, and nails.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo above is Mariatu, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone.  Mariatu has been a professional teacher for nine years.  A native of Makeni city, Mariatu is 35 years old.  She is married to a teacher and the couple has two children.  Her children attend primary and secondary schools. 

Mariatu has requested this loan to pay her college fees. At the end of each month, she will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay her college fees.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with four children and none of her children goes to school.  

She sells second hand clothes at the market.  She has been in this business for the last 10 years.  She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second hand clothes.  Her major challenge are increasing prices of used clothes and seasonality. 

Her aspirations and goals are to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land.  She lives in a rented house and her family has access electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en:
Gibrilla is a primary school teacher in Makeni.  Thirty-three year old, Gibrilla was born in Makeni.  He is single and has two children who attend secondary school.  

Gibrilla has served in the teaching profession for eight years.  He has requested this loan to pay his college fees.

Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org base in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleases to present Gibrilla to you.

loans.use: to pay his college fees.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Pictured above is Isatu, a primary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. 

The twenty-eight year old has served in the teaching profession for seven years.  Isatu is married to a teacher and the couple has three children: one attends secondary school and the others are not of school going age. 

Isatu has requested this loan to pay school fees for her child and to buy house building materials like zinc, sand, nails, cements, etc. for the construction of a house.  At the end of each month, Isatu will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child and to buy house building materials for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Florence sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are defaulters and thieves. 

Florence’s aspirations and goals are to sell wholesale only, to start going to the villages of Masaka for green bananas, and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water but does not have access to electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Fatmata J.

texts.en:
Pictured above is Fatmata, a primary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. She has served in the teaching profession for nine years now. Fatmata is single with four children: one in primary school, two in secondary and one in college.  

She has requested this loan in order to pay school fees and other school-related charges for her children. And at the end of each month, she will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay school fees and other school-related charges for her children.

loans.name: Clara Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Clara Isabel tiene un negocio de ventas y reparaciones de  tóner e impresoras, desea un préstamo para surtir su negocio de material para el rellenar los tóner  y comprar piezas para la reparación de la impresoras, ya que cuando le solicitan una de estos servíos tener todo en existencia en su negocio y poder atender a los clientes inmediato.
El propósito de la señora Clara Isabel es brindar un mejor servicio, y así su negocio podrá tener un mejor ingreso para sus hijos quienes el apoyan y ayudan en el negocio que es familiar.
texts.en:
Clara Isabel has a business selling toner, and repairing printers. She wishes a loan to supply her business with material for refilling toner cartridges, and to buy parts for repairing printers. This is so that when they ask her for one of these services, she has everything in stock in her business, and can serve customers right away.

Clara Isabel's aim is to offer better service. This way, her business will be able to provide better income for her children. They support her, and help in the business, which is a family business.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her business selling printer inks and repairing printers.

loans.name: José Fernando

texts.es:
El señor José Fernando esta adquiriendo este préstamo ya que su hijo esta por entrar a la universidad y tiene que pagar la inscripción y la compra de libros y material y desea apoyar a su hijo con el pago para que empieza su carrera profesional. 
Don José Fernando es mecánico y su esposa realiza trabajos de belleza en su domicilio, entre los dos ingresos desean darle los mejor a sus hijos y que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José Fernando is taking out this loan, as his son is about to enter university, and has to pay enrollment fees and also buy books and supplies. He wants to support his son in paying for this, so that he can start his degree program.

José Fernando  is a mechanic, and his wife has a beauty salon in their home. Between the two incomes, they wish to provide the best for their children, so that they have a better future.

loans.use: To pay education expenses for his son's university enrollment.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and all of her children go to school. She has two additional family members (mother and father). 

She sells Cavendish bananas at the market. She has been in the business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more clusters and bunches of Cavendish bananas. 

Her major business challenges are defaulters, transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to buy a plot of land and build a house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but doesn’t have piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of Cavendish bananas.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with three children, and all of her children go to school. She has two additional family members (her old parents). 

She sells charcoal at the market. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. 

Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to become a wholesaler and to build a house. She lives in a  rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Edwin Eleaquin

texts.es:
Edwin, es empleado de una panadería, vive con su familia, está soltero, su familia le apoya, lleva 7 años en la panadería, como panificador, tiene ya mucha experiencia, fabricando el pan de calidad.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para una motocicleta, ya que en ella se trasporta desde su casa hacia el trabajo y viceversa, con esto pagara el mecánico que le revise la moto, además comprara arena, cemento y piedras, para hacer unas reparaciones en el corredor de la casa de sus padres.
El objetivo de Edwin es seguir trabajando en la panadería, y en un futuro con su experiencia poder instalar su propia panadería.
texts.en:
Edwin is an employee in a bakery.  He lives with his family and is single.  His family supports him.  He has been working in the bakery as a baker for seven years.  He already has a lot of experience making quality bread.

He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for a motorcycle that he uses for transportation to and from his job.  With the loan he will pay the mechanic to check the motorcycle for him.  He also will buy sand, cement, and stones to make some repairs in the corridor of his parents' house.

Edwin's objective is to continue working in the bakery, and in the future, with his experience be able to set up his own bakery.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land to build her own house. 

She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, and both of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She operates a retail business in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil. Her major business challenges are the increasing prices of commodities, transportation and on-and-off electricity. 

Her aspirations and goals are to own a wholesale shop and to build a house. She lives in a rented house, and the family does not have access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking oil, rice and flour.

loans.name: Endanilla

texts.en:
Endanilla is married with 4 children. Endanilla is 63 years old and lives in Sinian, Baliangao.
Endanilla sells "Hypo", a stain remover, to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,200 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase stain remover called Hypo for her retail business.
Endanilla has been a member of PMPC for 11 years.

loans.use: To purchase Hypo stain remover her retail business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 51 years old and lives in Sipaloc, Sibutad. She is married with three children. 

Evelyn has a mini gold processing business and earns approximately 6,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase chemicals needed for gold processing. 

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals needed for gold processing.

loans.name: Gerly

texts.en:
Gerly is a widow with 5 children. She is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Gerly is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for a year. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase ten sacks of feed for her pigs. 
Gerly has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: To purchase ten sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with 3 children. She is 47 years old and lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga.
Erlinda sells grocery items to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,300 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 20,000 to purchase five sheets of plywood and nails for the grocery store building expansion.
Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: To purchase five sheets of plywood and nails for grocery store building expansion

loans.name: Rosas De Rosas Pampa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE ROSAS PAMPA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rufina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: ayudante de construcción, costura de polleras, venta de comida, artesanía en perlas, venta de fruta, venta de helado. 

La señora Rufina indica que hace tres años que integra en Pro Mujer  ingresando por invitación de amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de helados que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su hermana.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el crecimiento de su negocio (compra de leche y esencias) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializa a en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo de nuestra institución.
texts.en:
The "Rosas de Rosas Pampa" communal bank will start its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación Center. It is made up of six members, and led by a board of directors, of which Rufina is the president. 

The businesses carried on the members of the communal bank are varied, and among them we have: construction helper, sewing skirts, selling food, handicrafts with pearls, selling fruit, and selling ice cream. 

Rufina says she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, at the invitation of friends. At the present time, she has a business selling ice cream, which she has been working at for years, having learned it from her sister. The loan she will take out now is for helping her business grow, by buying milk and flavor essences that she will acquire in La Ceja. After making her product, she sells it at her stand. 

This form of work allows her to generate income for supporting her family as much as she can; as she is married, and has six children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes everything about our institution.

loans.use: To buy milk and flavor essences.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es: Luis de 34 años vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, familia con la cual ha salido adelante a partir de un negocio, en el cual vende artículos de piñatería y cerámica, así como tarjetas y accesorios para decorar las fiestas. Cuando Luis dejó de ser empleado de un granero, decidió emprender una actividad independiente, mediante la cual pudiera lograr generar bienestar para su familia. Acudiendo a la experiencia de su cónyuge, quien por tradición conocía este tipo de negocio,  fue así como  identificó un local, invirtió en productos de piñatería, tarjetería y empezó a vender en un punto muy comercial, Su negocio ha crecido gradualmente y se ha especializado en todo lo referente a fiestas: tarjetas, piñatas, recordatorios, en cartón, icopor y porcelanicron especialmente. En la actualidad su  sueño de incrementar su capital de trabajo se hace cada vez mayor, porque sus clientes aumentan diariamente; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, mediante el que comprará biscochos en cerámica, y en cartonería, lo mismo que artículos de piñatería, en mayor volumen para lograr disminuir sus precios de venta e incrementar  su capital de trabajo. Su mayor desafío fue adquirir créditos a particulares, que le resultaron muy onerosos y no lo dejaban avanzar. Pero esto es cosa del pasado y ahora quiere lograr ampliarlo con mucha disciplina de trabajo, responsabilidad y dedicación de él y de su cónyuge, para lograr aumentar el bienestar de sus hijos que crecen y a los que quieren brindarle un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Luis, 34, lives with his wife and his children, aged 6 and 4. He has moved his family ahead with a business selling party decorations such as piñatas and ceramic items, as well as cards and accessories. 

When Luis left his job in a granary, he decided to start his own business in order to be able to improve his family’s well-being. Drawing on his wife’s experience with this kind of business, he found a shop, invested in piñatas and cards and began selling in a very commercial area. His business has gradually grown and he has specialized in everything pertaining to parties: cards, piñatas, mementos in cardboard, styrofoam and especially cold porcelain.

Currently his dream of increasing his working capital is growing because his customer base is expanding daily. That is why he came to KIVA for a loan, which he will use to buy ceramic and cardboard items, as well as piñatas, in greater volume in order to lower his sales price and increase his working capital. His greatest challenge was when he acquired private loans, which were very onerous and did not allow him to get ahead. But that is in the past and now, with his and his wife’s dedication, work discipline and sense of responsibility, he wants to expand his business in order to increase his children’s well-being so they can grow and have a successful future.

loans.use: to buy ceramic and cardboard items, as well as piñatas, in greater quantities so that he can lower his sales price.
